### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1995, four-year-old Kevin injures himself in an incident that his six-year-old sister Kaylee attributes to sleepwalking.
2) Kevin is taken to a hospital and brought back home.
3) The siblings wake up in the middle of the night to find that their father has disappeared and that the windows, doors, and other objects in their house are gradually vanishing.
4) Kevin suggests they sleep downstairs, where they watch cartoons on television.
5) They awaken to find the house still dark, hear an unexplained thumping noise, and find a chair upside-down on the ceiling.
6) Kevin then suggests that their father "went with mom" but Kaylee does not want to talk about their mother.
7) The toilet in the downstairs bathroom disappears.
8) On their way to the upstairs bathroom, Kaylee sees a doll on a bedroom ceiling and Kevin ends up too frightened to use the toilet, so they decide to place two buckets in the downstairs bathroom.
9) A mysterious voice calls to Kaylee from the darkness and tells her to come upstairs, where she sees their father in a bedroom.
10) He tells her to look under the bed, but she does not see anything.
11) She then sees their mother sitting on the bed.
12) Her mother says that she and their father love Kaylee and Kevin, and instructs her to close her eyes before vanishing.
13) Kaylee looks at the open closet and hears her mother say "there's someone here".
14) From the closet, she hears her mother calling her name as well as moans of pain and bones breaking.
15) She is startled by a hand reaching around a corner and panics.
16) Kaylee runs downstairs, where Kevin helps her push the couch to block off the hallway from which the voice was calling her.
17) When Kevin falls asleep, the voice calls Kaylee again.
18) When Kevin wakes up, he sees that Kaylee is gone and toys and objects are suspended against a wall.
19) The voice beckons Kevin into the basement, where he sees Kaylee, who no longer has eyes or a mouth.
20) The voice tells him it wants to play as some of the toys begin to disappear.
21) A drawer opens in the kitchen, and Kevin complies with the voice's command that he insert a knife into one of his eyes.
22) Kevin calls 9-1-1 and whispers to the operator that he was cut with a knife and feels sick.
23) The operator tells him to stay on the line and that adults are on their way.
24) Kevin says that the doors have disappeared before dropping the phone.
25) The phone turns into a Chatter Telephone toy and the voice claims responsibility for this, telling Kevin that it can "do anything".
26) It says that Kaylee disobeyed it and demanded to see her parents, so it took away her mouth.
27) It tells Kevin to come upstairs.
28) Holding a flashlight, Kevin finds himself on the ceiling.
29) He walks into a bedroom which becomes a void, and a dollhouse is shown sitting on a pile of toys in a seemingly infinite hallway as onscreen text reads "572 days".
30) A woman is seen sitting on the bed and her head slowly fades away, followed by the rest of her body.
31) Photos are shown of people, except their faces are either missing or distorted.
32) Kevin cries out as blood splatters onto the floor, then disappears and splatters repeatedly.
33) He asks if he can watch something happy, followed by an apparition of a door.
34) In the dark, an unidentifiable face appears over him in his bed, telling him to go to sleep.
35) Kevin asks for the face's name twice, but it does not respond.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The story opens in 1985, in the cold, monochromatic office space of the National Investigative Agency's (NIA) Behavioral Science Division located in Washington D.C.
2) Within the office, a glass-walled conference room serves as the central hub for the unit's senior agents.
3) Amidst this crowd of seasoned NIA veterans, a young, eager agent named John Everyman breaks free from the standard procedure.
4) Everyman proposes a controversial idea - a comprehensive behavioral study of the notorious criminal, Nicholas Carter.
5) Everyman embarks on an unnerving journey to Maryland's foreboding maximum-security prison, hoping to have an official face-to-face with Carter.
6) Months of diligent work ensue, filled with intense scrutiny over hours of recorded conversations with Carter and meticulous documenting of body language.
7) Everyman begins to notice unsettling tendencies in Carter's mannerisms and speech, drawing chilling parallels with the modus operandi of numerous unsolved cases.
8) Regardless of the increasing complexity and Carter's rigid resilience, Everyman meticulously compiles his observations.
9) Everyman carries on, dedicating hours at the daunting prison interviewing Carter, slowly breaking through the hardened shell of the man.
10) Everyman’s steadfast determination enables him to decipher the obscure signals in his conversations with Carter, essentially unearthing bone-chilling testimonies of past murders along with an ominous prediction of future crimes.
11) His relentless dedication to deciphering Carter's enigmatic world begins to bleed into his personal life and professional standing.
12) Yet, Everyman remains unflinchingly committed to solving the mystery once and for all.
13) Everyman continues his rigorous mission undeterred, fully committed to exposing the elusive truth hidden within Carter’s cryptic narrative.
14) After painstaking analysis of Carter's confounding riddles, Everyman stumbles upon the plot of an impending heinous crime.
15) On discovering this, Everyman urgently appeals to his superiors at the NIA, only to be met with blatant dismissal due to his perceived inferiority.
16) With the weight of desperation heavy, Everyman, during their next prison meeting, confronts Carter about the plans for imminent disaster.
17) Carter delights in Everyman's torment, further confounding him with evasive answers about potential threats.
18) This interaction ignites the beginning of Everyman's urgent race against time, vying to prevent a tragedy predicted by Carter.
19) As time tightens its grip, Everyman recruits an unconventional team from a few reliable colleagues who believe in his instincts.
20) Together, they dive headfirst into the convoluted maze of Carter’s tales, each serving as an essential piece of the puzzle revealing a portrait of relentless horror.
21) Everyman’s relentless pursuit finally bares fruit in the form of a triumphant last-minute success.
22) They manage to thwart a disastrous train bombing in downtown Washington D.C., saving countless lives.
23) The victory, however, is fleeting.
24) Within hours, Carter succumbs to a sudden cardiac arrest, leaving behind a chilling legacy of numerous unsolved cases and unanswered questions.
25) Left alone in the aftermath, Everyman grapples with the mixture of euphoria from the victory and grief for the loss of the only direct link to unresolved crimes.
26) His heroic efforts are duly recognized by the NIA, finally earning him the merits for delving into the intricate network of Carter's past and preventing the city-wide disaster.
27) Everyman is left alone in Carter’s now abandoned cell, surrounded by countless unresolved mysteries, resigned to his fate as Carter’s unintentional successor.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 7.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 13.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 15.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 22.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)

- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)

- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

instruction:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Eight years after the events of the first film, Jonas Taylor has been involved in fighting environmental crimes while also helping Mana One in exploring a further deep part of the Mariana Trench where the Megalodon had been found.
2) Following the death of Suyin Zhang, Jonas has been raising her teenage daughter Meiying alongside her uncle and Suyin's brother Jiuming Zhang, who has acquired his father's company alongside wealthy financier Hillary Driscoll.
3) Mana One has also been studying an 80 ft (24 m) female Meg called Haiqi, who was discovered as a pup and trained by Jiuming in a reserve in Hainan.
4) Recently, Haiqi has been acting erratically, leading to Jonas being concerned despite Jiuming's enthusiasm.
5) Jonas and Jiuming lead a routine submersible exploration to the Trench, with Meiying stowing away to see the trench for the first time.
6) Fellow Meg survivors DJ and Mac observe the group from the Mana One.
7) On their way down, the subs are pursued by Haiqi, who escaped captivity the previous night; the subs dive down through the thermocline to escape, but Haiqi forces her way through it anyway.
8) Two much larger Megs, a massive alpha male and a slightly smaller beta male, appear and mate with Haiqi.
9) While working on an escape plan, Jonas and his team discover an illegal mining operation in a station captained by the mercenary Montes, who has a vendetta against Jonas for his imprisonment some time before.
10) Montes' crew was hired by the secretly corrupt Driscoll to covertly use the Mana One's access to the trench to farm rare earth minerals that could earn them billions.
11) Montes kills his crew in an explosion to cover up their activities, which causes a rupture in the trench and grounds both Jonas’ and Jiuming's ships.
12) DJ, Mac, and fellow Mana One analyst Jess discover that the rescue pod has been sabotaged, forcing the crew to use exosuits to walk towards the station in the creature-filled trench, with only Jonas, Meiying, Jiuming and security officer Rigas surviving the journey.
13) Jess reveals herself as a traitor and attempts to remotely kill the four, but they escape the station in another submersible after a scuffle with Montes, who escapes to the surface through a buoy.
14) Driscoll sends mercenaries to take over the Mana One while Montes surfaces and meets with Jess.
15) As the crew surfaces, they discover the rupture from earlier which leads to several of the creatures, including the three Megs, a swarm of lizard-like creatures known as Snappers and a giant octopus escaping the trench and reaching the surface.
16) Jonas’ crew meets with DJ and Mac, and Montes focuses the mercenaries on the crew after Jess is devoured by a Meg.
17) Jonas’ team escapes to a nearby resort, Fun Island, to warn them of the approaching creatures.
18) Driscoll, Montes and the mercenaries arrive at Fun Island to kill Jonas’ crew, but they are instead attacked by the Snappers, who devour Driscoll and several mercenaries.
19) Jonas’ group splits up to evacuate the tourists as the Megs and the octopus begin their attack.
20) Jonas manages to kill the beta male Meg using an explosive taped to a harpoon before being attacked by Montes, leading both to sail to the beach.
21) The two battle before Jonas knocks Montes into the mouth of the alpha Meg to be consumed.
22) Jiuming creates a bomb out of fertilizer and along with Mac takes over Driscoll's unattended helicopter to fly towards the beach where Meiying is trying to help tourists.
23) The octopus takes down the helicopter and Jiuming injures it with his bomb, attracting Haiqi, who engages in a battle with the octopus and proceeds to kill the beast.
24) As Jiuming swims towards the wreckage to save Mac, Jonas picks up one of the helicopter's rotors and uses it to fatally impale the alpha Meg through the head.

2) Following the death of Suyin Zhang, Jonas has been raising her teenage daughter Meiying alongside her uncle and Suyin's brother Jiuming Zhang, who has acquired his father's company alongside wealthy financier Hillary Driscoll.
3) Mana One has also been studying an 80 ft (24 m) female Meg called Haiqi, who was discovered as a pup and trained by Jiuming in a reserve in Hainan.

17) Jonas’ team escapes to a nearby resort, Fun Island, to warn them of the approaching creatures.
18) Driscoll, Montes and the mercenaries arrive at Fun Island to kill Jonas’ crew, but they are instead attacked by the Snappers, who devour Driscoll and several mercenaries.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The beginning of the movie is showcased with a high-octane sequence featuring Alliance 127, a commercial Boeing 777, falling victim to a hijack.
2) The consequent turmoil that ensues as the ill-fated plane meets its tragic end in a devastating crash is presented through a series of heart-wrenching sequences.
3) Leapfrogging to 2020, the narrative presents John Decker, a veteran CIA agent, being handed a classified report about Alliance 127.
4) The case is being reopened, due to the revelation of fresh evidence discovered amidst the debris of the crash site.
5) John, intrigued by the persisting anomalies that had marred the initial investigations, delves deep into the buried case files, seeking connections that previously slipped attention.
6) Assembling a team of relentless pursuers from different CIA branches, John includes Sarah Wilson, an audacious and brilliant field operative known for her ability to thrive under pressure.
7) Their relentless probe yields disconcerting leads that suggest a premeditated hijacking, turning the narrative on its head.
8) A comprehensive background check of the passengers puts a spotlight on nefarious connections connecting some of them to notorious underworld figures and high-ranking government officials.
9) Unknown enemies target Sarah with brutal precision, culminating in a shocking personal tragedy - the suspicious car crash that claims her brother Robert's life.
10) As they bore deeper into the case, 'Legacy', an obscure anti-terrorism operation, emerges as a potential cipher, capable of shedding light on their gnarly quest for the truth.
11) The narrative takes a sharp twist when it's revealed that 'Legacy' was sabotaged from within.
12) It's revealed to be an inside job, with government tiers connected to the conspiracy.
13) As John and his team grapple with collecting evidence against the powerful traitors, a deadly cat-and-mouse game ensues.
14) Meanwhile, Sarah undertakes a daring mission to infiltrate a base camp operated by the enemy.
15) In what follows, Sarah engages in an adrenaline-pumping chase to dodge her pursuers, barely managing to escape with the crucial evidence.
16) However, a jarring plot twist waits as a bullet strikes Sarah before she can completely evade capture.
17) In her final moments, she hands over the evidence to John.
18) Armed with the retrieved evidence, John wages a relentless battle against the corrupt officials.
19) As the malicious web behind the Alliance 127 incident unravels, a chilling truth casts a grim shadow over the international political panorama.
20) Yet, the resolution offers some relief as the innocent victims of the flight are exonerated posthumously.
21) The movie wraps up with emotionally stirring scenes, etching Sarah's ultimate sacrifice in the hearts of the audience, whose valorous spirit is immortalized by John as he lays a single red rose on her grave.
22) Taking a vow by her grave, John carries forth their shared mission of justice and transparency, promising to honor her legacy.

- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 5.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.

- Point of No Return (tp3): 13.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 14.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) To support their dying mother Carol, 17-year-old Matt forces his 14-year-old brother Joey to rob a remote home being fumigated.
2) Security guard Dave Hamby chases the two boys through a forest, but falls into an abandoned well.
3) Matt insists on leaving Hamby in the hole so he cannot turn the brothers in to the police.
4) Feeling guilty about leaving the man trapped, Joey regularly visits Hamby to bring him water, food, a sleeping bag, and a walkie-talkie.
5) When he discovers what his brother is doing, Matt urinates on Hamby's head to reassert authority.
6) Incensed when Joey continues bonding with the man, Matt drops an open pesticide canister into the hole to kill Hamby.
7) Joey confronts Matt when he learns his brother used the stolen money meant for their mother to host a motel party.
8) Matt responds by telling partygoers that Joey steals from retired people.
9) Joey retaliates by revealing that Matt killed a man.
10) Matt threatens and beats Joey.
11) Joey runs back home where Carol's TV news program reveals the man in the well is actually Randy Michael Sadler, a fugitive wanted for murdering his wife and children.
12) Joey returns to the hole and discovers Randy survived the pesticide by wearing the gas mask Joey dropped during the chase.
13) Randy admits he stole a security guard's uniform and was trying to retrieve the stolen money for himself.
14) Joey bargains to rescue Randy from the well in exchange for help punishing Matt.
15) Joey brings Randy home after using a rope to get him out of the hole.
16) Carol recognizes Randy from the news bulletin.
17) Carol is shocked to discover Joey is helping Randy go on the run.
18) At the same time, Matt reports Joey as the thief to police officers Smith and Crane, who are investigating the initial vandalism;  Matt inadvertently implicates himself in the robbery (and knowing Randy was imprisoned in a hole but failed to notify police).
19) Matt accompanies the two officers back to the house where a standoff ensues with Randy.
20) Randy shoots both officers, but Joey stops him from killing them.
21) Randy and Joey then take Matt to the hole in the forest.
22) After forcing Matt into the well, Randy compels Joey to shout angry invectives at his brother.
23) Randy then pushes Joey into the hole.
24) Matt beats Joey unconscious.
25) Randy starts limping away when Carol confronts him at gunpoint.
26) Carol reveals she killed her abusive husband.
27) Following a conversation about her troubled family, Carol shoots Randy dead.
28) Fearing he killed his brother, Matt finally manages to rouse Joey and tearfully apologizes for all he has done.
29) Matt and Joey embrace as Carol comes to their rescue.

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 6.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 11.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 18.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 27.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

instruction:
### INSTRUCTIONS

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 2003, Amy Loughren is a single mother and nurse working in the intensive care unit (ICU) at Parkfield Memorial Hospital in New Jersey, who is suffering from cardiomyopathy, unbeknownst to anyone at the hospital, and fears dismissal.
2) Having no health insurance, Amy has no other choice than to remain working for another four months, in order to acquire the insurance to afford a heart transplant.
3) The hospital recruits experienced nurse Charles Cullen to help her work the night shifts, and they quickly become good friends.
4) Charlie discovers her condition and empathetically agrees to keep it a secret.
5) When an elderly patient named Ana Martinez, who was being looked after by Amy and Charlie, suddenly dies, the hospital's administrative board contacts the state police, represented by detectives Danny Baldwin and Tim Braun.
6) However, the board, led by risk manager Linda Garran, quickly downplays it, claiming the death was unintentional and that the reason for reporting it was simply to abide by health protocol.
7) Baldwin is immediately wary of the situation, noting they reported Martinez's death seven weeks after its occurrence after the body had been cremated.
8) He fixates on Charlie and discovers he had been convicted of minor charges in 1995.
9) They question Amy who notices that insulin had been administered to Martinez, demonstrated by her decreased C peptide levels, despite her being a non-diabetic.
10) She is questioned about Charlie's character but Amy is quick to challenge them.
11) Baldwin and Braun attempt to contact the hospitals where Charlie had worked previously but none are willing to cooperate.
12) Parkfield finally shares its investigation with the police, but Baldwin notices that it is fragmentary, leading him to snap at Garran, causing him and Braun to be banned from the hospital.
13) Meanwhile, after Kelly Anderson, another ICU patient suffers a seizure and inexplicably dies, Amy discovers insulin had also been administered to her the night before.
14) Suspicious, she contacts an old friend, Lori, a fellow nurse who worked with Charlie at a different hospital.
15) Lori reveals that during Charlie's employment, the ward he was assigned to dealt with numerous sudden deaths, with the discovery of insulin in several of them.
16) Shocked, Amy raids Parkfield's storage, discovering holes in several IV bags, indicating they had been contaminated.
17) During her discovery, she collapses and ends up in the ER.
18) Finally convinced of Charlie's complicity, she alerts the detectives.
19) They convince Kelly's husband to exhume her body in order to perform an autopsy; it reveals a dual combination of insulin and digoxin led to her death.
20) Meanwhile, Garran fires Charlie under the pretext of minor discrepancies found in his résumé.
21) In an attempt to entice Charlie into disclosing his actions, Baldwin and Braun have Amy arrange a meeting with him, but he reacts aggressively when she asks about his dismissal from Parkfield.
22) The police arrest and hold him, but are unable to get him to confess on record.
23) Unwilling to see him released, Amy volunteers to talk to Charlie; she has a warm conversation with him, and asks that he tells the truth.
24) After some deliberation, Charlie confesses, stating that he simply "did it".
25) When Amy asks why, he says, "they didn't stop me."
26) A textual epilogue reveals Charlie was sentenced to 18 consecutive life sentences for the murders of 29 patients but that the actual number could be as high as 400.
27) Amy underwent the heart surgery she needed, and now lives in Florida with her daughters and grandchildren.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 3.5 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 9.5 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 15.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 19.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

The condition list [4, 5, 4, 6, 8] shows an initial improvement, a drop as challenges escalate, and then a consistent improvement as the protagonist works through the difficulties and towards a resolution.

7) Baldwin is immediately wary of the situation, noting they reported Martinez's death seven weeks after its occurrence after the body had been cremated.
8) He fixates on Charlie and discovers he had been convicted of minor charges in 1995.
9) They question Amy who notices that insulin had been administered to Martinez, demonstrated by her decreased C peptide levels, despite her being a non-diabetic.
10) She is questioned about Charlie's character but Amy is quick to challenge them.
11) Baldwin and Braun attempt to contact the hospitals where Charlie had worked previously but none are willing to cooperate.
12) Parkfield finally shares its investigation with the police, but Baldwin notices that it is fragmentary, leading him to snap at Garran, causing him and Braun to be banned from the hospital.
13) Meanwhile, after Kelly Anderson, another ICU patient suffers a seizure and inexplicably dies, Amy discovers insulin had also been administered to her the night before.
14) Suspicious, she contacts an old friend, Lori, a fellow nurse who worked with Charlie at a different hospital.
15) Lori reveals that during Charlie's employment, the ward he was assigned to dealt with numerous sudden deaths, with the discovery of insulin in several of them.
16) Shocked, Amy raids Parkfield's storage, discovering holes in several IV bags, indicating they had been contaminated.
17) During her discovery, she collapses and ends up in the ER.
18) Finally convinced of Charlie's complicity, she alerts the detectives.
19) They convince Kelly's husband to exhume her body in order to perform an autopsy; it reveals a dual combination of insulin and digoxin led to her death.
20) Meanwhile, Garran fires Charlie under the pretext of minor discrepancies found in his résumé.
21) In an attempt to entice Charlie into disclosing his actions, Baldwin and Braun have Amy arrange a meeting with him, but he reacts aggressively when she asks about his dismissal from Parkfield.
22) The police arrest and hold him, but are unable to get him to confess on record.
23) Unwilling to see him released, Amy volunteers to talk to Charlie; she has a warm conversation with him, and asks that he tells the truth.
24) After some deliberation, Charlie confesses, stating that he simply "did it".
25) When Amy asks why, he says, "they didn't stop me."
26) A textual epilogue reveals Charlie was sentenced to 18 consecutive life sentences for the murders of 29 patients but that the actual number could be as high as 400.
27) Amy underwent the heart surgery she needed, and now lives in Florida with her daughters and grandchildren.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The film begins with the protagonist, Emma, lost in the fascination of her research work on the possible existence of extraterrestrial beings.
2) As a highly accomplished astronomer, she conducts her research in her rural Victorian-style turret home.
3) Immersed in her research, she carefully documents greatly detailed star profiles and navigates the tremendous data on numerous computer screens spread in her study.
4) She receives an unanticipated stream of unfamiliar sounds through her advanced communication systems.
5) Emma realizes that these pulsating, mysterious sounds could be a potential celestial signal from the unexplored depths of outer space.
6) Piqued by this unusual occurrence, Emma uses her custom-built decoding systems to decipher these puzzling extraterrestrial signals.
7) It dawns upon her with great surprise and fear that not only does she understand these alien-coded transmissions, but she is also unintentionally privy to galactic secrets yet unknown to mankind.
8) What starts as a mere curiosity blossoms into a terrifying realization—an imminent and violent invasion from an aggressive extraterrestrial force which threatens to erase Earth from the galactic map entirely.
9) Disoriented yet stoic, Emma understands that the unique genetic ability she possesses, which allows her to understand otherworldly codes, could be the single, fragile thread standing between Earth and total annihilation.
10) As the first rays of dawn break, she is joined at her secluded observatory, located on a serene grassy hilltop, by a duo of solemn individuals cloaked in flawlessly tailored black suits.
11) These unknown visitors reveal their identities, showing her official laminated ID cards embedded with the emblem "Earth Defense Initiative" (EDI).
12) The EDI agents then bring her up to speed on confidential intelligence they have amassed, details which eerily align with the lethal invasion plot that she had deciphered from the alien message.
13) Saddled with the terrifying reality that she might be Earth's sole chance at survival, Emma reluctantly accepts her unexpected role with the EDI.
14) Emma, burdened by an unsettling anxiety but driven by determination, steps into her unfamiliar territory, shouldering an inconceivable responsibility beyond her imaginings.
15) She relocates to the covert EDI headquarters slyly nestled within a breathtaking backdrop of snow-capped mountains, and grows to know her new team.
16) The EDI team, a diverse group of stern military strategists, esteemed scholars, and some seasoned veterans, has been carefully chosen for this mission.
17) Emma forms a unique bond with one of the team members, Max, a charismatic and reflective physicist who helps her navigate the complex landscape of this alien technology.
18) Emma and the EDI team devote their days and nights to developing a secure plan to counter the looming alien invasion.
19) Their plan revolves around fabricating an advanced human-alien hybrid defense technology, capable of neutralizing the aliens' superior technological prowess.
20) Emma undertakes strenuous physical training to master the controls of the alien weaponry along with an understanding of grounded military tactics.
21) Amid the rigorous training sessions and meticulous strategizing, Emma and Max find solace in each other as their fears and the hopes for the world lead to a deep emotional bonding.
22) Just as the EDI base is buzzing with preparations to test their cutting-edge defense system, an unexpected calamity strikes.
23) Caught unaware, the alien forces have launched a pre-emptive strike, decimating the EDI base and severely damaging the novel hybrid defense system.
24) Now on the backfoot and left picking up the pieces of their broken strategy, Emma and the team battle to resurrect their plan amidst their burgeoning despair.
25) Although facing challenging circumstances, Emma ingeniously revives the hybrid defense system utilizing her understanding of the alien technology.
26) Quickly pulling themselves together to face the invading forces, the EDI members rally around Emma, their unity hardened by a shared struggle as they prepare for the do-or-die battle.
27) The time has come as the night sky, illuminated by the eerie glow of the alien fleet, marks the eve of the decisive battle.
28) Emma, driven by determination and leadership, expertly assumes command of the hobbled defense system, guiding her team in the raging tempest of war.
29) Max, her right hand throughout this ordeal, sustains critical injuries in the onslaught, further fueling Emma's resolve to save not just her loved ones but all of humanity from impending doom.
30) In the face of the nearing alien invaders, Emma manages to activate the seemingly futile hybrid defense technology just in time.
31) This results in a massive technical failure within the alien fleet, shredding them to oblivion, thereby averting Earth's destruction.
32) After the overwhelming exertion, Emma loses her consciousness.
33) Awakening from her blackout, she is offered the permanent leadership of the EDI—a proposition she earnestly declines, choosing a serene life over the relentless danger of interstellar wars.
34) Emma makes it clear that she wants to return to her lifework of astrological research.
35) As Earth starts to pick up the pieces from the foiled invasion, Emma reclaims her quiet life in the comfort of her quaint, rural home.
36) Max, having survived his near-fatal injuries, pays her an unexpected visit.
37) He expresses his unwavering affection for her.
38) Emma reciprocates Max’s feelings, finding in him an unwavering steadiness that was missing in her life.
39) They envisage a shared future, but suddenly, an unexpected twist leaves them on tenterhooks.
40) A known signal disruption echoes from Emma's radio set, hinting at an incoming interstellar communication that persuades a sense of foreboding nostalgia.
41) Emma, apprehensive yet adhering to her duty, hesitantly deciphers the incoming transmission.
42) The alien communication springs to life again, this time with a twist, unrecognizable from the previous ones but metallic and distinctly alien.
43) The encoded message expires abruptly, leaving Emma and Max contemplating the enormity of the challenge they might have to face again.
44) With a heavy sigh, Emma archives the unreadable transmission.
45) The camera pulls back, capturing the world bustling below, oblivious to the lurking threat, slowly zooming back to our heroes-Emma and Max.
46) They stand resolute, an agreement silently re-cemented in their purposeful gaze, ready to face the forthcoming storm.
47) Their love story stands as an icon of human spirits and emotions which even the mightiest alien forces fail to extinguish.
48) Their camaraderie and collective resilience become a beacon of hope for the survival of mankind, facing any impending threats and revitalizing their spirit.
49) The final scene begins to unfold with Emma and Max studying the night sky, fear, and fascination glowing subtly in their eyes.
50) Emma’s story ends—a scientist-turned-reluctant-hero, transformed into the savior of humanity, catapulted back into the shadows of an impending crisis just as she barely manages to take a breather.
51) The last shot showcases Earth—a stunning orb, floating alone in deep, indigo cosmos—indicating the secretive battles and unsung heroes that lurk beneath.

- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 8.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 15.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 23.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 31.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:

2) As a highly accomplished astronomer, she conducts her research in her rural Victorian-style turret home.
3) Immersed in her research, she carefully documents greatly detailed star profiles and navigates the tremendous data on numerous computer screens spread in her study.
4) She receives an unanticipated stream of unfamiliar sounds through her advanced communication systems.
5) Emma realizes that these pulsating, mysterious sounds could be a potential celestial signal from the unexplored depths of outer space.
6) Piqued by this unusual occurrence, Emma uses her custom-built decoding systems to decipher these puzzling extraterrestrial signals.
7) It dawns upon her with great surprise and fear that not only does she understand these alien-coded transmissions, but she is also unintentionally privy to galactic secrets yet unknown to mankind.
8) What starts as a mere curiosity blossoms into a terrifying realization—an imminent and violent invasion from an aggressive extraterrestrial force which threatens to erase Earth from the galactic map entirely.
9) Disoriented yet stoic, Emma understands that the unique genetic ability she possesses, which allows her to understand otherworldly codes, could be the single, fragile thread standing between Earth and total annihilation.
10) As the first rays of dawn break, she is joined at her secluded observatory, located on a serene grassy hilltop, by a duo of solemn individuals cloaked in flawlessly tailored black suits.
11) These unknown visitors reveal their identities, showing her official laminated ID cards embedded with the emblem "Earth Defense Initiative" (EDI).
12) The EDI agents then bring her up to speed on confidential intelligence they have amassed, details which eerily align with the lethal invasion plot that she had deciphered from the alien message.
13) Saddled with the terrifying reality that she might be Earth's sole chance at survival, Emma reluctantly accepts her unexpected role with the EDI.
14) Emma, burdened by an unsettling anxiety but driven by determination, steps into her unfamiliar territory, shouldering an inconceivable responsibility beyond her imaginings.
15) She relocates to the covert EDI headquarters slyly nestled within a breathtaking backdrop of snow-capped mountains, and grows to know her new team.
16) The EDI team, a diverse group of stern military strategists, esteemed scholars, and some seasoned veterans, has been carefully chosen for this mission.
17) Emma forms a unique bond with one of the team members, Max, a charismatic and reflective physicist who helps her navigate the complex landscape of this alien technology.
18) Emma and the EDI team devote their days and nights to developing a secure plan to counter the looming alien invasion.
19) Their plan revolves around fabricating an advanced human-alien hybrid defense technology, capable of neutralizing the aliens' superior technological prowess.
20) Emma undertakes strenuous physical training to master the controls of the alien weaponry along with an understanding of grounded military tactics.
21) Amid the rigorous training sessions and meticulous strategizing, Emma and Max find solace in each other as their fears and the hopes for the world lead to a deep emotional bonding.
22) Just as the EDI base is buzzing with preparations to test their cutting-edge defense system, an unexpected calamity strikes.
23) Caught unaware, the alien forces have launched a pre-emptive strike, decimating the EDI base and severely damaging the novel hybrid defense system.
24) Now on the backfoot and left picking up the pieces of their broken strategy, Emma and the team battle to resurrect their plan amidst their burgeoning despair.
25) Although facing challenging circumstances, Emma ingeniously revives the hybrid defense system utilizing her understanding of the alien technology.
26) Quickly pulling themselves together to face the invading forces, the EDI members rally around Emma, their unity hardened by a shared struggle as they prepare for the do-or-die battle.
27) The time has come as the night sky, illuminated by the eerie glow of the alien fleet, marks the eve of the decisive battle.
28) Emma, driven by determination and leadership, expertly assumes command of the hobbled defense system, guiding her team in the raging tempest of war.
29) Max, her right hand throughout this ordeal, sustains critical injuries in the onslaught, further fueling Emma's resolve to save not just her loved ones but all of humanity from impending doom.
30) In the face of the nearing alien invaders, Emma manages to activate the seemingly futile hybrid defense technology just in time.
31) This results in a massive technical failure within the alien fleet, shredding them to oblivion, thereby averting Earth's destruction.
32) After the overwhelming exertion, Emma loses her consciousness.
33) Awakening from her blackout, she is offered the permanent leadership of the EDI—a proposition she earnestly declines, choosing a serene life over the relentless danger of interstellar wars.
34) Emma makes it clear that she wants to return to her lifework of astrological research.
35) As Earth starts to pick up the pieces from the foiled invasion, Emma reclaims her quiet life in the comfort of her quaint, rural home.
36) Max, having survived his near-fatal injuries, pays her an unexpected visit.
37) He expresses his unwavering affection for her.
38) Emma reciprocates Max’s feelings, finding in him an unwavering steadiness that was missing in her life.
39) They envisage a shared future, but suddenly, an unexpected twist leaves them on tenterhooks.
40) A known signal disruption echoes from Emma's radio set, hinting at an incoming interstellar communication that persuades a sense of foreboding nostalgia.
41) Emma, apprehensive yet adhering to her duty, hesitantly deciphers the incoming transmission.
42) The alien communication springs to life again, this time with a twist, unrecognizable from the previous ones but metallic and distinctly alien.
43) The encoded message expires abruptly, leaving Emma and Max contemplating the enormity of the challenge they might have to face again.
44) With a heavy sigh, Emma archives the unreadable transmission.
45) The camera pulls back, capturing the world bustling below, oblivious to the lurking threat, slowly zooming back to our heroes-Emma and Max.
46) They stand resolute, an agreement silently re-cemented in their purposeful gaze, ready to face the forthcoming storm.

48) Their camaraderie and collective resilience become a beacon of hope for the survival of mankind, facing any impending threats and revitalizing their spirit.
49) The final scene begins to unfold with Emma and Max studying the night sky, fear, and fascination glowing subtly in their eyes.
50) Emma’s story ends—a scientist-turned-reluctant-hero, transformed into the savior of humanity, catapulted back into the shadows of an impending crisis just as she barely manages to take a breather.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) After a post-graduation road trip, Elle still hasn't decided between going to Berkeley or Harvard – although Noah is already looking for an off-campus apartment for them.
2) When Noah and Lee's parents announce they're selling the beach house where they all spent their childhoods, Elle, Noah, Lee, and Lee's girlfriend, Rachel, spend the summer there to help prepare for the sale.
3) Lee shows Rachel his plans for them to see each other on holidays while going to colleges across the country from each other, while Elle is suddenly faced with Berkeley's deadline.
4) Choosing to go to Harvard with Noah upsets Lee, so she promises to spend the summer doing their beach bucket list together.
5) Noah's friend Chloe – whom Elle once thought he was having an affair with – arrives at the beach house, while Marco (whom Elle kissed) gets a job in the area.
6) During a day at the waterpark, Noah and Marco clash, prompting Noah to call Elle naive for not seeing that Marco still has feelings for her.
7) Tensions escalate when she struggles to divide her time between the brothers.
8) Simultaneously, Elle struggles with accepting her father's new girlfriend, Linda (also a friend of her late mom), fearing that she'll replace her.
9) Encouraged by Chloe (who is coping with her parents' divorce) to talk to Elle, Noah makes up with her.
10) Marco shows up at the Fourth of July party where he again fights with Noah and punches him, but Noah refuses to retaliate.
11) Marco admits to Elle he does still have feelings for her, but she rejects him.
12) That night, Elle fights with her father over Linda, accusing him of only dating her for his own pride; in response, he angrily recounts the sacrifices he has made for her and her brother Brad and that she is not the only person who deserves to be loved.
13) Unaware that Noah saw her acceptance letter to Berkeley, Elle goes to find him at their spot.
14) Worried she's only going to Harvard for him and that she will regret it, Noah breaks up with her.
15) Heartbroken, Elle misses a bucket list with Lee to play Dance Dance Revolution.
16) Arguing, Lee tells her that he's never mattered to her compared to Noah, while she tells him to grow up and that all of her decisions this summer have been about trying to make everybody happy.
17) Noah and Lee's mother tells Elle she should start thinking about what she wants to do and choose a college based on that.
18) Chloe and Elle talk about Noah while saying goodbye, with Rachel eavesdropping on their conversation.
19) Having seen the issues Elle and Noah's relationship had, Rachel breaks up with Lee, though she hopes they will someday reunite.
20) Acknowledging how happy her brother is around her, Elle eventually understands and accepts Linda, reconciling with her father.
21) Marco apologizes to her and they say their farewells amicably before she makes up with Lee.
22) She's realized that she's spent so long maintaining her relationships with Noah and Lee that she hasn't worked out what makes her happy.
23) Elle applies to University of Southern California to study game design.
24) Inspired by her, Noah and Lee's mom decides not to sell the beach house.
25) Six years later, Elle is developing her own game.
26) She and Lee remain best friends, visiting the fated Kissing Booth at the Charity Fair and Carnival.
27) Additionally, Lee and Rachel got back together and became engaged after college.
28) Elle sees Noah for (presumably) the first time since their breakup there, where he reveals he has job offers at law firms in both LA and New York.
29) Noah suggests going on a motorcycle ride when he's back in town and Elle agrees.
30) They part ways, but not before looking back at each other.
31) Elle and Noah ride down the coastline in California on their motorcycles, laughing and having fun.

- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)

- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.

- Point of No Return (tp3): 12.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.

### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) After a post-graduation road trip, Elle still hasn't decided between going to Berkeley or Harvard – although Noah is already looking for an off-campus apartment for them.
2) When Noah and Lee's parents announce they're selling the beach house where they all spent their childhoods, Elle, Noah, Lee, and Lee's girlfriend, Rachel, spend the summer there to help prepare for the sale.
3) Lee shows Rachel his plans for them to see each other on holidays while going to colleges across the country from each other, while Elle is suddenly faced with Berkeley's deadline.
4) Choosing to go to Harvard with Noah upsets Lee, so she promises to spend the summer doing their beach bucket list together.
5) Noah's friend Chloe – whom Elle once thought he was having an affair with – arrives at the beach house, while Marco (whom Elle kissed) gets a job in the area.
6) During a day at the waterpark, Noah and Marco clash, prompting Noah to call Elle naive for not seeing that Marco still has feelings for her.
7) Tensions escalate when she struggles to divide her time between the brothers.
8) Simultaneously, Elle struggles with accepting her father's new girlfriend, Linda (also a friend of her late mom), fearing that she'll replace her.
9) Encouraged by Chloe (who is coping with her parents' divorce) to talk to Elle, Noah makes up with her.
10) Marco shows up at the Fourth of July party where he again fights with Noah and punches him, but Noah refuses to retaliate.
11) Marco admits to Elle he does still have feelings for her, but she rejects him.
12) That night, Elle fights with her father over Linda, accusing him of only dating her for his own pride; in response, he angrily recounts the sacrifices he has made for her and her brother Brad and that she is not the only person who deserves to be loved.
13) Unaware that Noah saw her acceptance letter to Berkeley, Elle goes to find him at their spot.
14) Worried she's only going to Harvard for him and that she will regret it, Noah breaks up with her.
15) Heartbroken, Elle misses a bucket list with Lee to play Dance Dance Revolution.
16) Arguing, Lee tells her that he's never mattered to her compared to Noah, while she tells him to grow up and that all of her decisions this summer have been about trying to make everybody happy.
17) Noah and Lee's mother tells Elle she should start thinking about what she wants to do and choose a college based on that.
18) Chloe and Elle talk about Noah while saying goodbye, with Rachel eavesdropping on their conversation.
19) Having seen the issues Elle and Noah's relationship had, Rachel breaks up with Lee, though she hopes they will someday reunite.
20) Acknowledging how happy her brother is around her, Elle eventually understands and accepts Linda, reconciling with her father.
21) Marco apologizes to her and they say their farewells amicably before she makes up with Lee.
22) She's realized that she's spent so long maintaining her relationships with Noah and Lee that she hasn't worked out what makes her happy.
23) Elle applies to University of Southern California to study game design.
24) Inspired by her, Noah and Lee's mom decides not to sell the beach house.
25) Six years later, Elle is developing her own game.
26) She and Lee remain best friends, visiting the fated Kissing Booth at the Charity Fair and Carnival.
27) Additionally, Lee and Rachel got back together and became engaged after college.
28) Elle sees Noah for (presumably) the first time since their breakup there, where he reveals he has job offers at law firms in both LA and New York.
29) Noah suggests going on a motorcycle ride when he's back in town and Elle agrees.
30) They part ways, but not before looking back at each other.
31) Elle and Noah ride down the coastline in California on their motorcycles, laughing and having fun.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 6.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 12.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 16.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 23.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

instruction:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Best friends and college students Sean and Kunle prepare to become the first black men to complete the "Legendary Tour", a practice of visiting seven fraternity parties in one night.
2) Along with their Latino friend and roommate Carlos, they discover the unconscious body of Emma, an underaged white woman, in their living room.
3) Sean argues that if they call the police, the color of their skin would be enough to raise suspicion.
4) Kunle convinces the group to take Emma to a hospital 10 minutes away.
5) Meanwhile, Emma's sister Maddy and her friends Alice and Rafael start to look for her.
6) The three friends first try an alternate option—dumping Emma's body off outside of one of the parties.
7) As Kunle leaves them to be the lookout, an incident leads several students to chase him off the property and throw objects at their car, shattering a tail light.
8) Maddy uses a phone tracker app to find Emma's location.
9) Carlos accidentally gives Emma a bottle of alcoholic "Death Punch", mistaking it for a sports drink.
10) Sean is unable to convince his relative to lend him his car.
11) Emma regains consciousness and begins to scream when she sees she is inside a stranger's vehicle.
12) She breaks Carlos's nose and kicks Kunle in the face, causing them to crash the car.
13) Emma then runs off into the woods and the three of them chase after her.
14) They find her passed out in a tree and bring her back into their vehicle as Maddy, Alice, and Rafael find them.
15) Maddy attacks Sean and Kunle with a branch and accidentally pepper sprays herself.
16) Carlos and Rafael, who reveal they are cousins, calm the rest of the group down and explain the situation, though Maddy remains skeptical, asking Emma if any of them assaulted her.
17) Carlos asks how they were able to track Emma, and Maddy reveals that her phone was tucked into her bra, convincing the group that they were truly trying to help her.
18) A scared Sean abandons the group and goes to the "Underground", the last frat party of the "Legendary Tour".
19) Emma begins to overdose as Carlos drives everyone to the hospital.
20) As Kunle performs CPR to save Emma's life, the group is chased by the police, who believe they have kidnapped Emma.
21) They are stopped by the police just as they make it to the emergency room.
22) The police point a gun at Kunle, the only black man in the car.
23) Alice later explains the situation to the police.
24) Kunle and Carlos are allowed to leave.
25) A white police officer tells Kunle that they should have just called the police in the first place.
26) Sean and Kunle reunite and make up.
27) The morning after the events, Emma and Maddy bring a gift basket to the boys' house and Emma apologizes before Maddy tells her to wait outside.
28) As Maddy begins to read a handwritten apology about involving the police, Kunle shuts the door in her face.
29) While playing a round of Jenga, Sean notices Kunle showing symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder at the sound of distant sirens.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 6.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 14.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 19.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 26.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE
output:
To classify the story arc type, we need to follow the instructions provided.

1. **Identify the protagonist in the story**: The protagonists in the story are Sean and Kunle, but since the story arc classification focuses on the overall development, we can consider Kunle as the primary protagonist for the sake of analysis, given his consistent involvement and the emotional trajectory hinted at the end.

2. **At the sentence indicated by the first turning point, state the sentence again, and describe the protagonist's state**: 
   - The first turning point (Opportunity) is at sentence 2: "Along with their Latino friend and roommate Carlos, they discover the unconscious body of Emma, an underaged white woman, in their living room."
   - The protagonist's state is one of sudden concern and responsibility, having found an unconscious underage girl in their living room. This discovery sets them on a path of trying to handle the situation without involving the police, due to concerns about racial profiling. Condition: 5

3. **Identify the second turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the first turning point**:
   - The second turning point (Change of Plans) is at sentence 6: "The three friends first try an alternate option—dumping Emma's body off outside of one of the parties."
   - The situation has escalated, with the friends now considering illegal and morally questionable actions, indicating a worsening of their condition due to the desperation and poor decision-making. Condition: 3

4. **Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point**:
   - The third turning point (Point of No Return) is at sentence 14: "They find her passed out in a tree and bring her back into their vehicle as Maddy, Alice, and Rafael find them."
   - At this point, the protagonists are fully committed to their goal of helping Emma and are now facing the consequences of their actions, including confrontation with Emma's sister and friends. However, they are taking actions that, despite the chaos, aim towards resolving the situation. Condition: 4

5. **Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point**:
   - The fourth turning point (Major Setback) is at sentence 19: "Emma begins to overdose as Carlos drives everyone to the hospital."
   - The situation has become critical, with Emma's life in danger, and the protagonists are facing a severe setback as they rush to save her. This is a low point in their condition. Condition: 2

6. **Identify the fifth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the fourth turning point**:
   - The fifth turning point (Climax) is at sentence 26: "Sean and Kunle reunite and make up."
   - After the chaos and the critical situation with Emma, the protagonists have managed to resolve the immediate crisis (as implied by the events leading to this point), and now they are reunifying and making amends, which indicates an improvement in their condition. Condition: 8

7. **Approximate the protagonist's condition in the story as a number from 0 to 10 at every turning point**:
   - The list of conditions in chronological order is: 5, 3, 4, 2, 8

8. **Classify the story arc type based on the protagonist's condition list and explain your reasoning**:
   - The story starts with the protagonists in a concerning situation (5), then it worsens (3), slightly improves as they commit to their actions (4), hits a low point with a major setback (2), and finally improves significantly as they overcome their challenges and reunite (8). This pattern shows a deterioration followed by an improvement, which aligns with the "Man in a Hole" story arc type. The protagonists fall into a difficult situation, face challenges, and then find a way out, ending in a better condition than when they first encountered the problem.

9. **Determined story arc type**:
   - Man in a Hole

instruction:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie opens with a brief scene of Detective Paterson accusing a man called Knuckles of kidnapping, and threatens him with life in prison.
2) As the detective squeezes his throat, Knuckles finally gasps, "she's dead."
3) Wealthy real-estate agent Will Spann and his wife Lisa are driving to Lisa's parents' house, where she wants some time to herself.
4) Before reaching the house, they stop for gas and Lisa heads inside to purchase a bottle of water.
5) As she leaves the store she's greeted by a man, but as she moves toward him a large white truck pulls up, blocking the rest of their interaction from view.
6) Will finishes gassing up and looks for Lisa, but cannot find her in the store or bathrooms.
7) He starts to panic, frantically searching the entire area, calling her phone, and asking if anyone's seen her.
8) He finally calls the local police department to report her disappearance and heads to her parents' house.
9) Lisa's parents, Barry and Anna Adams, get into a minor argument with Will as he tries to tell them what happened and asks for their help in locating her.
10) A flashback reveals the tension between the couple, where Lisa suggests some time apart but can't explain why she's no longer invested in their marriage.
11) Will heads back to the gas station and meets Detective Paterson, who questions the gas station clerk, Oscar, asking for security footage, but Oscar claims the cameras are broken.
12) The detective returns to the station but Will notices the camera's indicator lamp is lit.
13) He queries Oscar, and after a fight retrieves the CCTV recorder, which he takes to Paterson at the station.
14) They see the start of Lisa's interaction before the white truck blocks the view, then the people are gone, also the older model automobile around the corner.
15) Detective Paterson then takes Will to the interrogation room, but the questions lead Will to believe he is suspected of arranging her disappearance due to marital problems.
16) He leaves angrily and shows the picture of the man and his car from the security footage to Anna and Barry; they identify him as Knuckles, their handyman, and it's his car.
17) Will breaks into Knuckles' trailer and questions him about Lisa.
18) They get into a violent fight in which Will finally subdues Knuckles and takes his gun.
19) Knuckles says he was forced to leave Lisa with someone named Frank.
20) Will binds Knuckles, bundles him into his trunk, and drives off to find Frank, but gets pulled over for speeding.
21) The cop demands Will step out of his car to search it.
22) Will knows the cop will find Knuckles in the trunk, and flees through the woods on the side of the road.
23) Meanwhile, Detective Paterson visits Barry and Anna, who reveal Lisa's affair with "Clint", but that she had rebuffed his attempts to renew their relationship.
24) Another flashback indicates Anna was distrustful of Will.
25) Will reaches a lower road and encounters a man who turns out to be a Frank's guard, but talks him into letting him pass.
26) He finds Frank's camp in the woods, a derelict farm, the main building of which is an extensive but rudimentary drug lab.
27) Most of the inhabitants are unconcerned at his presence.
28) He sees Oscar arrive, confirming his earlier suspicions.
29) Will sneaks around the camp in search of Lisa.
30) A flashback reveals the moment Knuckles takes Lisa, threatening her into his car.
31) Will stalks Frank into the building and pulls the gun, begging him to reveal where his wife is.
32) A firefight ensues, ending up with Frank and one of his men dead.
33) A small fire starts on the floor, not far from drug chemicals and tanks of flammable solvent.
34) The opening scene with Detective Paterson and Knuckles replays, as Paterson pushes Knuckles to confess.
35) Finally, Knuckles reveals Lisa is dead, and how he had kidnapped her as part of a ransom plot, describing how he'd been forced by Frank to "fix his mistake" and dig a hole to bury her.
36) Will, now free to search the camp, encounters Oscar, who reveals he has Lisa's phone and that he knows where she is, demanding $20,000 for information.
37) The building suddenly explodes, killing Oscar, and Detective Paterson arrives on-scene.
38) He tells Will to stay and goes to investigate the hole, finding it empty.
39) At the same time, Will hears banging from a nearby shed and finds a terrified but alive Lisa tied up.
40) They embrace and he carries her out.
41) Detective Paterson visits the Adams' residence to share information with Will about Knuckles' confession.
42) He also reveals his awareness that not all individuals in the drug lab perished due to the explosion, as evidenced by gunshot wounds found on some of the bodies.
43) Despite these revelations, Detective Paterson does not pry any further.
44) Instead, he wishes Will luck and departs.
45) Subsequently, Lisa invites Will to accompany her into her parents' house.
46) The movie concludes with the two of them walking towards the house, smiling and holding hands.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie opens with a brief scene of Detective Paterson accusing a man called Knuckles of kidnapping, and threatens him with life in prison.
2) As the detective squeezes his throat, Knuckles finally gasps, "she's dead."
3) Wealthy real-estate agent Will Spann and his wife Lisa are driving to Lisa's parents' house, where she wants some time to herself.
4) Before reaching the house, they stop for gas and Lisa heads inside to purchase a bottle of water.
5) As she leaves the store she's greeted by a man, but as she moves toward him a large white truck pulls up, blocking the rest of their interaction from view.
6) Will finishes gassing up and looks for Lisa, but cannot find her in the store or bathrooms.
7) He starts to panic, frantically searching the entire area, calling her phone, and asking if anyone's seen her.
8) He finally calls the local police department to report her disappearance and heads to her parents' house.
9) Lisa's parents, Barry and Anna Adams, get into a minor argument with Will as he tries to tell them what happened and asks for their help in locating her.
10) A flashback reveals the tension between the couple, where Lisa suggests some time apart but can't explain why she's no longer invested in their marriage.
11) Will heads back to the gas station and meets Detective Paterson, who questions the gas station clerk, Oscar, asking for security footage, but Oscar claims the cameras are broken.
12) The detective returns to the station but Will notices the camera's indicator lamp is lit.
13) He queries Oscar, and after a fight retrieves the CCTV recorder, which he takes to Paterson at the station.
14) They see the start of Lisa's interaction before the white truck blocks the view, then the people are gone, also the older model automobile around the corner.
15) Detective Paterson then takes Will to the interrogation room, but the questions lead Will to believe he is suspected of arranging her disappearance due to marital problems.
16) He leaves angrily and shows the picture of the man and his car from the security footage to Anna and Barry; they identify him as Knuckles, their handyman, and it's his car.
17) Will breaks into Knuckles' trailer and questions him about Lisa.
18) They get into a violent fight in which Will finally subdues Knuckles and takes his gun.
19) Knuckles says he was forced to leave Lisa with someone named Frank.
20) Will binds Knuckles, bundles him into his trunk, and drives off to find Frank, but gets pulled over for speeding.
21) The cop demands Will step out of his car to search it.
22) Will knows the cop will find Knuckles in the trunk, and flees through the woods on the side of the road.
23) Meanwhile, Detective Paterson visits Barry and Anna, who reveal Lisa's affair with "Clint", but that she had rebuffed his attempts to renew their relationship.
24) Another flashback indicates Anna was distrustful of Will.
25) Will reaches a lower road and encounters a man who turns out to be a Frank's guard, but talks him into letting him pass.
26) He finds Frank's camp in the woods, a derelict farm, the main building of which is an extensive but rudimentary drug lab.
27) Most of the inhabitants are unconcerned at his presence.
28) He sees Oscar arrive, confirming his earlier suspicions.
29) Will sneaks around the camp in search of Lisa.
30) A flashback reveals the moment Knuckles takes Lisa, threatening her into his car.
31) Will stalks Frank into the building and pulls the gun, begging him to reveal where his wife is.
32) A firefight ensues, ending up with Frank and one of his men dead.
33) A small fire starts on the floor, not far from drug chemicals and tanks of flammable solvent.
34) The opening scene with Detective Paterson and Knuckles replays, as Paterson pushes Knuckles to confess.
35) Finally, Knuckles reveals Lisa is dead, and how he had kidnapped her as part of a ransom plot, describing how he'd been forced by Frank to "fix his mistake" and dig a hole to bury her.
36) Will, now free to search the camp, encounters Oscar, who reveals he has Lisa's phone and that he knows where she is, demanding $20,000 for information.
37) The building suddenly explodes, killing Oscar, and Detective Paterson arrives on-scene.
38) He tells Will to stay and goes to investigate the hole, finding it empty.
39) At the same time, Will hears banging from a nearby shed and finds a terrified but alive Lisa tied up.
40) They embrace and he carries her out.
41) Detective Paterson visits the Adams' residence to share information with Will about Knuckles' confession.
42) He also reveals his awareness that not all individuals in the drug lab perished due to the explosion, as evidenced by gunshot wounds found on some of the bodies.
43) Despite these revelations, Detective Paterson does not pry any further.
44) Instead, he wishes Will luck and departs.
45) Subsequently, Lisa invites Will to accompany her into her parents' house.
46) The movie concludes with the two of them walking towards the house, smiling and holding hands.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Jake Patterson, a man in the middle of life's complex maze, grappling with his turning fifty, wakes up to another on-the-surface unexceptional but internally restless day in the picturesque nostalgia-laced town of Elmwood, his home since childhood.
2) It becomes evident that Jake is still nurturing the embers of his feelings for his ex-wife, Rebecca, as he lovingly cradles an old yet cherished picture within his weathered-faded leather wallet, a remnant of their shared past showing her in a radiant and alluring light.
3) Setting out for the day, Jake finds himself face to face with a looming threat of rain, predicted by the local weather channel, tarnishing the quaintness of Elmwood.
4) His trusty, weather-beaten Ford chooses this precise moment to sputter its last breath and dies quite unceremoniously right in front of Rebecca's traditional red brick house.
5) Gazing at the familiar facade of Rebecca's home amidst his ruined plans, a spontaneous idea sparks within Jake's weary mind.
6) He contemplates stemming down the tide of his past and reignite his long-dormant bond with Rebecca.
7) He watches her from his incapacitated vehicle, cherishing the peals of her infectious laughter and the mesmerizing glow of her luminous smile.
8) The warm light pouring from her living room window captures this enchanting scene, confirming to Jake his decision.
9) His unexpected brush with the past gains momentum the following morning when he bumps into Rebecca at 'The Roasted Bean', a cafe that is an integral part of Elmwood's culture.
10) Their these chance encounter rekindles dormant emotions and revives a cascade of shared childhood memories.
11) Rebecca meets Jake with a charming, heart-warming smile that brings back memories of better days.
12) She introduces him to her fiance, a tall, charismatic architect named Richard.
13) But beneath Richard's charm lies a detached coldness that comes to the fore when Rebecca leaves Jake and Richard alone.
14) Jake quickly discerns a measured cold detachment underneath Richard's facade of pleasantness.
15) A wave of skepticism washes over Jake's otherwise open-minded nature, forcing him to delve into Richard's foggy past.
16) Jake immerses himself into a potentially dangerous quest, anxiety pushing him to its brink.
17) He begins unraveling fragments of Richard's murky past - a complicated puzzle he never anticipated.
18) Among the unsettling discoveries, Jake stumbles upon evidence of Richard's illicit activities, his secretive involvement with Elmwood's seedy underworld.
19) Trembling with fear for Rebecca's safety, he decides to unburden this alarming revelation.
20) He chooses Elmwood's tranquil park as the setting to unveil Richard's haunting secrets, only to be met with misconstrued allegations of attempting to sabotage Rebecca's happiness.
21) Their discussion reaches a tumultuous crescendo, mirroring the stormy heavens, dark clouds looming over Elmwood finally decid to pour their contents, indicating the overflow of their pent-up emotions.
22) Time poses as a cruel reminder, with each passing day bringing Rebecca's wedding date closer.
23) Jake's desperation peaks, his resolve to free Rebecca from Richard's crafty clutches is more robust than ever.
24) Friendly confrontations with Richard take an ugly turn, culminating in violent physical encounters.
25) Each scar on Jake stands testimony to Richard's sinister and violent inclinations.
26) Richard's true colors become blatantly apparent when he orders his underbelly associates to target Jake, culminating in a brutal and disorganized brawl in a shabby, dimly-lit alleyway.
27) Rebecca, acutely unaware of Richard's callous modus operandi, stumbles upon the violent scene, unprepared for the harsh reality that Richard's concealed violence was about to be revealed.
28) An unexpected beam of lightning pierces the cover of darkness illuminating the merciless expression on Richard's face and sending a chilling wave of dread coursing down Rebecca's spine.
29) The violent confrontation persists even as the storm gathers strength, the showdown amplifies in line with the unforgivable tempest's ferocity.
30) Amidst the storm's relentless onslaught, Richard's malicious personality finally meets its equal and opposite force of retribution.
31) The well-guarded secret of his clandestine wrongdoings is laid bare in front of the startled attendees at the grand wedding.
32) The reactions range from shock, disbelief, to outright terror.
33) Observing the reactions of childhood friends and family, Rebecca glimpses the depth of the near disaster she almost embraced.
34) She feels an overwhelming wave of relief mingled with feelings of betrayal and shock.
35) Amidst the chaos and tumult compounded by the storm, Rebecca rushes towards the shattered, beaten figure of Jake, holding back years of bottled up tears.
36) She acknowledges his painful yet brave endeavor to protect her from the impending disaster.
37) Amid the cold downpour, Rebecca reaches out to Jake, their fingers intertwining, reigniting old sparks and setting the foundation for the rebirth of their relationship.
38) Despite the storm's wrath, they stand united, their history interwoven, becoming the fabric of their revived relationship.
39) Under the towering edifice of Elmwood's long-standing clock tower, amidst the desolation left by the storm, Jake and Rebecca share a heartfelt moment, softly pledging to repair and reconcile their complex relationship.
40) As the turbulence of the storm wanes, they discover solace in each other's arms amidst the flood-ravaged town of Elmwood, hopeful and optimistic for sunnier days.
41) They stand resolute in the face of wind, ready to sail into an uncertain future.
42) Even in the heaviest downfall, true love refuses to be snuffed out, and the darkest wrongdoings will eventually be stripped down to the spotlight.
