5) Gazing at the familiar facade of Rebecca's home amidst his ruined plans, a spontaneous idea sparks within Jake's weary mind.
6) He contemplates stemming down the tide of his past and reignite his long-dormant bond with Rebecca.
7) He watches her from his incapacitated vehicle, cherishing the peals of her infectious laughter and the mesmerizing glow of her luminous smile.
8) The warm light pouring from her living room window captures this enchanting scene, confirming to Jake his decision.
9) His unexpected brush with the past gains momentum the following morning when he bumps into Rebecca at 'The Roasted Bean', a cafe that is an integral part of Elmwood's culture.
10) Their these chance encounter rekindles dormant emotions and revives a cascade of shared childhood memories.
11) Rebecca meets Jake with a charming, heart-warming smile that brings back memories of better days.
12) She introduces him to her fiance, a tall, charismatic architect named Richard.
13) But beneath Richard's charm lies a detached coldness that comes to the fore when Rebecca leaves Jake and Richard alone.
14) Jake quickly discerns a measured cold detachment underneath Richard's facade of pleasantness.
15) A wave of skepticism washes over Jake's otherwise open-minded nature, forcing him to delve into Richard's foggy past.
16) Jake immerses himself into a potentially dangerous quest, anxiety pushing him to its brink.
17) He begins unraveling fragments of Richard's murky past - a complicated puzzle he never anticipated.
18) Among the unsettling discoveries, Jake stumbles upon evidence of Richard's illicit activities, his secretive involvement with Elmwood's seedy underworld.
19) Trembling with fear for Rebecca's safety, he decides to unburden this alarming revelation.
20) He chooses Elmwood's tranquil park as the setting to unveil Richard's haunting secrets, only to be met with misconstrued allegations of attempting to sabotage Rebecca's happiness.
21) Their discussion reaches a tumultuous crescendo, mirroring the stormy heavens, dark clouds looming over Elmwood finally decid to pour their contents, indicating the overflow of their pent-up emotions.
22) Time poses as a cruel reminder, with each passing day bringing Rebecca's wedding date closer.
23) Jake's desperation peaks, his resolve to free Rebecca from Richard's crafty clutches is more robust than ever.
24) Friendly confrontations with Richard take an ugly turn, culminating in violent physical encounters.
25) Each scar on Jake stands testimony to Richard's sinister and violent inclinations.
26) Richard's true colors become blatantly apparent when he orders his underbelly associates to target Jake, culminating in a brutal and disorganized brawl in a shabby, dimly-lit alleyway.
27) Rebecca, acutely unaware of Richard's callous modus operandi, stumbles upon the violent scene, unprepared for the harsh reality that Richard's concealed violence was about to be revealed.
28) An unexpected beam of lightning pierces the cover of darkness illuminating the merciless expression on Richard's face and sending a chilling wave of dread coursing down Rebecca's spine.
29) The violent confrontation persists even as the storm gathers strength, the showdown amplifies in line with the unforgivable tempest's ferocity.
30) Amidst the storm's relentless onslaught, Richard's malicious personality finally meets its equal and opposite force of retribution.
31) The well-guarded secret of his clandestine wrongdoings is laid bare in front of the startled attendees at the grand wedding.
32) The reactions range from shock, disbelief, to outright terror.
33) Observing the reactions of childhood friends and family, Rebecca glimpses the depth of the near disaster she almost embraced.
34) She feels an overwhelming wave of relief mingled with feelings of betrayal and shock.
35) Amidst the chaos and tumult compounded by the storm, Rebecca rushes towards the shattered, beaten figure of Jake, holding back years of bottled up tears.
36) She acknowledges his painful yet brave endeavor to protect her from the impending disaster.
37) Amid the cold downpour, Rebecca reaches out to Jake, their fingers intertwining, reigniting old sparks and setting the foundation for the rebirth of their relationship.
38) Despite the storm's wrath, they stand united, their history interwoven, becoming the fabric of their revived relationship.
39) Under the towering edifice of Elmwood's long-standing clock tower, amidst the desolation left by the storm, Jake and Rebecca share a heartfelt moment, softly pledging to repair and reconcile their complex relationship.
40) As the turbulence of the storm wanes, they discover solace in each other's arms amidst the flood-ravaged town of Elmwood, hopeful and optimistic for sunnier days.
41) They stand resolute in the face of wind, ready to sail into an uncertain future.
42) Even in the heaviest downfall, true love refuses to be snuffed out, and the darkest wrongdoings will eventually be stripped down to the spotlight.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In Highland, Texas, in 1998, Beavis and Butt-Head accidentally burn down their high school science fair.
2) Believing they are at-risk youth, a judge sends them to space camp at the Johnson Space Center, where they become engrossed in a docking simulator.
3) Impressed, the NASA astronaut Captain Serena Ryan invites them to train as astronauts, which they mistake as an offer for sex.
4) They undergo training and board the Space Shuttle Endeavour to study a micro black hole.
5) In space, Beavis and Butt-Head create a catastrophe.
6) When Serena volunteers to sacrifice herself, they mistake this for another offer of sex.
7) They put on their spacesuits, and watch Serena through a window as she prepares to change.
8) Enraged, Serena uses the shuttle controls to fling them into space, where they are sucked into the black hole.
9) The boys emerge in Galveston in 2022.
10) The Pentagon detects their arrival and begins tracking them; Serena, now governor of Texas, vows to kill them to cover up her attempted murder.
11) The boys meet intelligent versions of themselves from another universe, Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head, who explain that they have two days to enter a portal on top of Mount Everest to prevent the destruction of the multiverse.
12) Beavis and Butt-Head acquire an iPhone and accidentally activate Siri, which they mistake for Serena; Beavis develops feelings for her.
13) When Siri offers to set up their smart home, they believe Serena is waiting for them in Highland.
14) After Beavis becomes trapped in a port-a-potty, he and Butt-Head are transported to a university.
15) Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head urge them to enter the portal, which they have moved nearby, but instead they wander into a gender studies class, where the professor lectures them on white privilege.
16) Taking this to mean they have the right to do whatever they want, they steal a police car and are arrested.
17) In jail, Beavis takes pills given to him by an inmate, transforms into his hyperactive alter ego Cornholio, and incites an uprising.
18) Discovering that the boys seemingly died in 1998, the warden decides that they are angels and releases them.
19) The boys arrive home, expecting to find Serena, but find it has been placed for sale.
20) They blame each other and separate, but are quickly abducted by government officials.
21) Serena's downtrodden lieutenant, Jim Hartson, covertly frees the boys, saying he knows what Serena did to them.
22) Smart Beavis and Butt-Head urge them to enter the portal, but the boys ignore them.
23) All parties arrive at Beavis and Butt-Head's house.
24) As Serena is about to shoot them, she realizes they are not her enemies, only foolish teenagers.
25) Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head urge Beavis and Butt-Head to enter the portal, but Hartson is accidentally sucked in instead, closing the rift and saving the multiverse.
26) As Beavis attempts to express his love to Serena, Smart Beavis interrupts and offers to show her the cosmos; she leaves with him and Smart Butt-Head.
27) In exchange for their silence, the government gives Beavis and Butt-Head their home back in its original condition.
28) In another universe, the assembled alternative Beavises and Butt-Heads applaud Smart Beavis for becoming the first Beavis to have sex.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 9.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 13.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 20.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE
output:
### 1. Identify the protagonist in the story
The protagonists in the story are Beavis and Butt-Head.

### 2. At the sentence indicated by the first turning point, state the sentence again, and describe the protagonist's state.
The first turning point is at sentence 4: "They undergo training and board the Space Shuttle Endeavour to study a micro black hole."
At this point, Beavis and Butt-Head are undergoing training and are about to board the Space Shuttle, indicating a significant improvement in their situation from being at-risk youth to becoming involved in a prestigious space program. Their condition can be approximated as a 4, considering they are still somewhat clueless but are in a unique and potentially advantageous position.

### 3. Identify the second turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the first turning point.
The second turning point is at sentence 9: "The boys emerge in Galveston in 2022."
Here, Beavis and Butt-Head have emerged in a different time and place after being sucked into a black hole, which is a dramatic change but also presents them with new and unknown challenges. Their condition can be approximated as a 2, as they are disoriented and out of their element, but alive.

### 4. Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point.
The third turning point is at sentence 13: "When Siri offers to set up their smart home, they believe Serena is waiting for them in Highland."
At this point, Beavis and Butt-Head are interacting with Siri, mistaking her for Serena, and believe they are heading towards a reunion or a sexual encounter, which they perceive as positive. However, this is based on a misunderstanding, and their condition remains somewhat delusional. Their condition can be approximated as a 1, as they are still confused and misinterpreting their situation, but are hopeful.

### 5. Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point.
The fourth turning point is at sentence 20: "They blame each other and separate, but are quickly abducted by government officials."
Here, Beavis and Butt-Head's situation has deteriorated; they are separated, abducted, and face government action against them, which is a significant downturn. Their condition can be approximated as a 0, as they are at one of the lowest points in the story, facing separation and government intervention.

### 6. Identify the fifth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the fourth turning point.
The fifth turning point is at sentence 25: "Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head urge Beavis and Butt-Head to enter the portal, but Hartson is accidentally sucked in instead, closing the rift and saving the multiverse."
At this point, the crisis is resolved in an unexpected way, and Beavis and Butt-Head are spared from further immediate danger. Their condition improves significantly as they are no longer in immediate peril and the multiverse is saved, albeit not through their actions. Their condition can be approximated as a 10, considering they are alive, the multiverse is saved, and they are returned to a relatively safe and familiar environment.

### 7. List the protagonist's condition at each turning point.
Based on the analysis, the list of the protagonist's condition at each turning point is: [4, 2, 1, 0, 10].

### 8. Classify the story arc type based on the protagonist's condition list and explain your reasoning.
The story arc type can be classified as "Man in a Hole" because the protagonist starts in a relatively neutral or slightly positive situation (4), then falls into a series of worsening conditions (2, 1, 0), hitting a low point before ultimately emerging in a significantly better condition (10) than where they started. This pattern of falling into a dilemma and then finding a way out, ending better than at the beginning, aligns with the "Man in a Hole" story arc.

### 9. Determine the story arc type.
Man in a Hole

query:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In Highland, Texas, in 1998, Beavis and Butt-Head accidentally burn down their high school science fair.
2) Believing they are at-risk youth, a judge sends them to space camp at the Johnson Space Center, where they become engrossed in a docking simulator.
3) Impressed, the NASA astronaut Captain Serena Ryan invites them to train as astronauts, which they mistake as an offer for sex.
4) They undergo training and board the Space Shuttle Endeavour to study a micro black hole.
5) In space, Beavis and Butt-Head create a catastrophe.
6) When Serena volunteers to sacrifice herself, they mistake this for another offer of sex.
7) They put on their spacesuits, and watch Serena through a window as she prepares to change.
8) Enraged, Serena uses the shuttle controls to fling them into space, where they are sucked into the black hole.
9) The boys emerge in Galveston in 2022.
10) The Pentagon detects their arrival and begins tracking them; Serena, now governor of Texas, vows to kill them to cover up her attempted murder.
11) The boys meet intelligent versions of themselves from another universe, Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head, who explain that they have two days to enter a portal on top of Mount Everest to prevent the destruction of the multiverse.
12) Beavis and Butt-Head acquire an iPhone and accidentally activate Siri, which they mistake for Serena; Beavis develops feelings for her.
13) When Siri offers to set up their smart home, they believe Serena is waiting for them in Highland.
14) After Beavis becomes trapped in a port-a-potty, he and Butt-Head are transported to a university.
15) Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head urge them to enter the portal, which they have moved nearby, but instead they wander into a gender studies class, where the professor lectures them on white privilege.
16) Taking this to mean they have the right to do whatever they want, they steal a police car and are arrested.
17) In jail, Beavis takes pills given to him by an inmate, transforms into his hyperactive alter ego Cornholio, and incites an uprising.
18) Discovering that the boys seemingly died in 1998, the warden decides that they are angels and releases them.
19) The boys arrive home, expecting to find Serena, but find it has been placed for sale.
20) They blame each other and separate, but are quickly abducted by government officials.
21) Serena's downtrodden lieutenant, Jim Hartson, covertly frees the boys, saying he knows what Serena did to them.
22) Smart Beavis and Butt-Head urge them to enter the portal, but the boys ignore them.
23) All parties arrive at Beavis and Butt-Head's house.
24) As Serena is about to shoot them, she realizes they are not her enemies, only foolish teenagers.
25) Smart Beavis and Smart Butt-Head urge Beavis and Butt-Head to enter the portal, but Hartson is accidentally sucked in instead, closing the rift and saving the multiverse.
26) As Beavis attempts to express his love to Serena, Smart Beavis interrupts and offers to show her the cosmos; she leaves with him and Smart Butt-Head.
27) In exchange for their silence, the government gives Beavis and Butt-Head their home back in its original condition.
28) In another universe, the assembled alternative Beavises and Butt-Heads applaud Smart Beavis for becoming the first Beavis to have sex.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 9.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 13.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 20.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

instruction:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie begins in a placid Italian town called Cortona, renowned for its tranquil charm and intoxicating beauty.
2) Here resides Philip Carson, a retired investigator from the New York Police Department, who leads an secluded life in a villa perched strategically atop a hill, offering heart-stopping vistas of undulating vineyards swaying beneath the Tuscan sky.
3) As the unforgiving sunken sun peeps out coyly from its crimson bedding and heralds a new day, it casts a feeble, enchanting glow over the cobblestone streets and rust-tinged terra cotta roofs.
4) Philip, lost in the peaceful rhythm of Cortona, strolls through the small town square, seeking refuge in the narrow, serpentine lanes lined with ancient stone houses seeping with charm and character.
5) One fateful morning in which spring was blooming proudly on every balcony, there unfolds a perplexing twist that shatters the harmonious monotony of Philip's life.
6) On his iron-wrought gate, he finds a parcel tightly wrapped in brown paper bearing the logo of international delivery service, DHL.
7) Inside the package, a yellowed parchment folded with precision demands attention.
8) The elegant yet ominous handwritten message reads: "Relive what you left behind, Philip."
9) Ripples of confusion protrude on Philip's forehead, and a shiver of apprehension slides down his spine, causing his heart to pound with unease and uncertainty over who might be behind such a cryptic package.
10) His only confidante in the peaceful town of Cortona is a technology savant named Luca Martini.
11) Universally recognized as the 'Security Wallet’, he is the only friend Philip has come to trust and rely on in this charming, amicably alien town.
12) Together, they embark on a thrilling rollercoaster ride, delving deeply into Philip’s past NYPD cases to unravel the mystery locked within the DHL package.
13) Cortona, now kissing away its sun-dappled days, turns into a canvas for a string of captivating misadventures and unanticipated danger, arousing Philip's dormant detective instinct and pushing him into a world he thought he had bid farewell.
14) Through Philip's relentless pursuit aided by Luca's sharp intellect, they start to mine through dusty files of old cases revealing an astonishing discovery.
15) As Philip tears through the old files, he recognizes a name: Vicente Russo, a ruthless underworld kingpin of old and someone who had always managed to whisk away from Philip's clutches back in the crime-infested streets of New York.
16) As Philip scrambles to untangle the web of Russo’s activities, he stumbles on a confusing pattern buried within the trails of old investigations, interlinking his unsettled past with Russo's nefarious plans.
17) The deeper Philip digs, the more tangled the labyrinth becomes, stirring volatile phantoms hidden in the depths of forgotten NYPD operations.
18) Philip knows not where the path leads but knows it will be fraught with danger, pitting his old wounds against the cunning of a ruthless nemesis.
19) The thrilling pinnacle of the story unfurls amid the lush vineyard of 'Casa Bramasole', where Philip confronts Russo in an edge-of-the-seat battle of wits and courage.
20) Luca’s technological expertise acts as the checkmate move when they decipher the final enigmatic clue leading to Russo.
21) Their find equips them with a worthwhile advantage in the labyrinthine catacombs beneath 'Casa Bramasole', giving Philip the upper hand in an encounter with an enemy whose unpredictable nature surpasses even that of the Cortonese weather.
22) Against formidable odds, Philip endures it all, his seasoned investigation skills leading to the dramatic apprehension of the elusive Russo.
23) This decisive victory is a testament to Philip's experience and the power of strategic detective work, ensuring Russo’s capture and solving the cryptic puzzle that all began with a simple DHL package.
24) With the proverbial storm weathered, Philip reflects on how his shortcomings and failures have acted as stepping stones in honing his tenacious spirit.
25) Tired of his secluded existence and newly charged by the pulsating sense of victory and camaraderie, Philip decides to shed his desolation, embracing a more participative role in the Cortonese community that stood by him.
26) Philip, basking in the heartfelt stories and festive songs, opens the doors of his villa and more importantly, his heart, embracing the community he had previously viewed from a lens of solitude.
27) Meanwhile, Vicente Russo, the daunting ghost from Philip's NYPD days, languishes behind bars in Tuscany's famed Volterra prison, a poetic justice that underlines the ultimate victory of law and order, and the heroes responsible for its reinstatement.
28) With faith in humanity restored, Philip and Luca together act as guardians of their adopted haven, leaving no stone unturned to ensure peace and safety prevail.
29) Embracing a communal life that he had once overlooked, Philip starts attending local fests, encourages trade at the Sunday markets, and lends a hand in the grape harvests, integrating himself into the everyday life of his adopted hometown.
30) Philip’s social life blossoms amid choir-filled church services, sprawling sunflower fields, and vibrant local eateries serving authentic Italian delicacies, symbolizing his transformation from a reclusive detective to a loved member of the Cortonese community.
31) Cortona, once overshadowed by ominous threats and uncertainty, has reclaimed its serenity and returned to the tranquil state it was once renowned for.
32) With Philip and Luca acting as the heart of the community, Cortona blossoms into a safer haven that not only assures physical safety but also fosters a sense of unity and camaraderie among its inhabitants.
33) Gone are the days when Philip chose to spend lonely evenings puffing cigar smoke into the chilly Tuscan air on his secluded balcony.
34) Now, his days are filled with shared laughter and stories over bottles of nourishing Chianti, lively town festivities, and a growling bulldog at his feet, all testament to his complete integration into communal life.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)

complete-text:
### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie begins in a placid Italian town called Cortona, renowned for its tranquil charm and intoxicating beauty.
2) Here resides Philip Carson, a retired investigator from the New York Police Department, who leads an secluded life in a villa perched strategically atop a hill, offering heart-stopping vistas of undulating vineyards swaying beneath the Tuscan sky.
3) As the unforgiving sunken sun peeps out coyly from its crimson bedding and heralds a new day, it casts a feeble, enchanting glow over the cobblestone streets and rust-tinged terra cotta roofs.
4) Philip, lost in the peaceful rhythm of Cortona, strolls through the small town square, seeking refuge in the narrow, serpentine lanes lined with ancient stone houses seeping with charm and character.
5) One fateful morning in which spring was blooming proudly on every balcony, there unfolds a perplexing twist that shatters the harmonious monotony of Philip's life.
6) On his iron-wrought gate, he finds a parcel tightly wrapped in brown paper bearing the logo of international delivery service, DHL.
7) Inside the package, a yellowed parchment folded with precision demands attention.
8) The elegant yet ominous handwritten message reads: "Relive what you left behind, Philip."
9) Ripples of confusion protrude on Philip's forehead, and a shiver of apprehension slides down his spine, causing his heart to pound with unease and uncertainty over who might be behind such a cryptic package.
10) His only confidante in the peaceful town of Cortona is a technology savant named Luca Martini.
11) Universally recognized as the 'Security Wallet’, he is the only friend Philip has come to trust and rely on in this charming, amicably alien town.
12) Together, they embark on a thrilling rollercoaster ride, delving deeply into Philip’s past NYPD cases to unravel the mystery locked within the DHL package.
13) Cortona, now kissing away its sun-dappled days, turns into a canvas for a string of captivating misadventures and unanticipated danger, arousing Philip's dormant detective instinct and pushing him into a world he thought he had bid farewell.
14) Through Philip's relentless pursuit aided by Luca's sharp intellect, they start to mine through dusty files of old cases revealing an astonishing discovery.
15) As Philip tears through the old files, he recognizes a name: Vicente Russo, a ruthless underworld kingpin of old and someone who had always managed to whisk away from Philip's clutches back in the crime-infested streets of New York.
16) As Philip scrambles to untangle the web of Russo’s activities, he stumbles on a confusing pattern buried within the trails of old investigations, interlinking his unsettled past with Russo's nefarious plans.
17) The deeper Philip digs, the more tangled the labyrinth becomes, stirring volatile phantoms hidden in the depths of forgotten NYPD operations.
18) Philip knows not where the path leads but knows it will be fraught with danger, pitting his old wounds against the cunning of a ruthless nemesis.
19) The thrilling pinnacle of the story unfurls amid the lush vineyard of 'Casa Bramasole', where Philip confronts Russo in an edge-of-the-seat battle of wits and courage.
20) Luca’s technological expertise acts as the checkmate move when they decipher the final enigmatic clue leading to Russo.
21) Their find equips them with a worthwhile advantage in the labyrinthine catacombs beneath 'Casa Bramasole', giving Philip the upper hand in an encounter with an enemy whose unpredictable nature surpasses even that of the Cortonese weather.
22) Against formidable odds, Philip endures it all, his seasoned investigation skills leading to the dramatic apprehension of the elusive Russo.
23) This decisive victory is a testament to Philip's experience and the power of strategic detective work, ensuring Russo’s capture and solving the cryptic puzzle that all began with a simple DHL package.
24) With the proverbial storm weathered, Philip reflects on how his shortcomings and failures have acted as stepping stones in honing his tenacious spirit.
25) Tired of his secluded existence and newly charged by the pulsating sense of victory and camaraderie, Philip decides to shed his desolation, embracing a more participative role in the Cortonese community that stood by him.
26) Philip, basking in the heartfelt stories and festive songs, opens the doors of his villa and more importantly, his heart, embracing the community he had previously viewed from a lens of solitude.
27) Meanwhile, Vicente Russo, the daunting ghost from Philip's NYPD days, languishes behind bars in Tuscany's famed Volterra prison, a poetic justice that underlines the ultimate victory of law and order, and the heroes responsible for its reinstatement.
28) With faith in humanity restored, Philip and Luca together act as guardians of their adopted haven, leaving no stone unturned to ensure peace and safety prevail.
29) Embracing a communal life that he had once overlooked, Philip starts attending local fests, encourages trade at the Sunday markets, and lends a hand in the grape harvests, integrating himself into the everyday life of his adopted hometown.
30) Philip’s social life blossoms amid choir-filled church services, sprawling sunflower fields, and vibrant local eateries serving authentic Italian delicacies, symbolizing his transformation from a reclusive detective to a loved member of the Cortonese community.
31) Cortona, once overshadowed by ominous threats and uncertainty, has reclaimed its serenity and returned to the tranquil state it was once renowned for.
32) With Philip and Luca acting as the heart of the community, Cortona blossoms into a safer haven that not only assures physical safety but also fosters a sense of unity and camaraderie among its inhabitants.
33) Gone are the days when Philip chose to spend lonely evenings puffing cigar smoke into the chilly Tuscan air on his secluded balcony.
34) Now, his days are filled with shared laughter and stories over bottles of nourishing Chianti, lively town festivities, and a growling bulldog at his feet, all testament to his complete integration into communal life.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In a flashback, baby Charlene "Charlie" McGee sits in her crib, spontaneously setting the room ablaze with her pyrokinesis power and sending her father Andrew "Andy" McGee into a panic.
2) In another flashback, a young Andy and his girlfriend Victoria "Vicky" Tomlinson talk to a doctor in a clinical trial, who explains to them that they will be injected with the experimental chemical drug Lot-6, which secretly gives them supernatural powers: Andy gains telepathy, and Vicky gains telekinesis.
3) In the present day, Charlie is sitting at the kitchen table after having a nightmare.
4) Her parents join her and Charlie explains that she has been repressing something bad, her powers becoming more unstable.
5) She unintentionally causes a ruckus at her school after exploding a bathroom stall due to anger at being bullied.
6) Andy is shown using his power, "the push", to influence a client to stop smoking, although the strain causes his eyes to bleed.
7) Meanwhile, in a secret facility, Captain Jane Hollister, leader of the  Department of Scientific Intelligence (DSI), is monitoring thermal signatures caused by Charlie's outbursts.
8) She visits Doctor Joseph Wanless, creator of Lot-6 and the resulting superhumans, who implores Hollister to terminate Charlie before her powers become uncontrollable.
9) Hollister enlists fellow superhuman John Rainbird to assist her.
10) Rainbird visits the McGee home, confronting Vicky, who attempts to counterattack with her repressed telekinetic powers.
11) Rainbird kills her, holding Charlie at knifepoint as she and Andy enter the home.
12) Charlie's powers overwhelm him and she sends a concussive burst of flames throughout the house.
13) Andy and Charlie escape into their truck.
14) On the road, they encounter a man named Irv Manders.
15) After using the push to convince Irv to take them to Boston, they hitch a ride with him, stopping off at his house.
16) After Charlie accidentally stumbles upon his paralyzed wife, Irv flies into a rage before conceding that he occasionally overreacts.
17) Irv sits up all night watching a news report of the incident at the McGee home, which is being framed as murder by Andy.
18) Irv and Andy argue before Andy explains to Irv that he is just trying to protect his daughter.
19) Charlie tells Irv, after speaking telepathically with his wife, that she forgives him for the accident that left her paralyzed, causing him to relent and attempt to protect Andy and Charlie when the police appear due to his prior emergency call.
20) Rainbird appears in the bushes, kills the policemen, and then shoots Irv in the knee before black trucks roll in to pick up Charlie and Andy.
21) Andy uses his push to trick Rainbird so Charlie can escape to a forest.
22) Charlie spends time honing her fire powers before stealing a bike and clothes to follow her father's telepathic message to her from his cell at DSI.
23) Charlie finds DSI and takes an agent's pass card from him, then kills him after he draws his gun to attack her.
24) She follows a large staircase down to the restricted area where her father is being kept.
25) She reaches her father's glass-fronted cell, from inside which Hollister tells her not to try and burn her, lest she burn her father in the process.
26) Andy tells Charlie that Rainbird, not he, telepathically called for her.
27) Seeing no other way out, and knowing that he will die soon, he apologizes to her and then pushes her to burn the entire place down, starting with Hollister and himself.
28) The now-rogue Charlie sets both on fire, mentally unlocks all the security doors, and walks through the facility killing all of the DSI agents.
29) Rainbird is released when his holding cell is unlocked.
30) Charlie is surrounded by men in hazmat suits, unable to harm them.
31) The men are about to subdue her when Rainbird shoots them from behind.
32) He surrenders to Charlie and kneels for her judgment.
33) Charlie starts to kill him but sees herself in the mirror and, realizing that he is just as much of a pawn as her, she spares him, before finally burning the rest of the building down.
34) Later, Charlie is seen walking onto a beach with Rainbird following behind.
35) With nowhere to go, Charlie allows Rainbird to carry her, and they walk off together into the night.

- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 2.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 8.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 15.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 27.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 33.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

6) Andy is shown using his power, "the push", to influence a client to stop smoking, although the strain causes his eyes to bleed.
7) Meanwhile, in a secret facility, Captain Jane Hollister, leader of the  Department of Scientific Intelligence (DSI), is monitoring thermal signatures caused by Charlie's outbursts.
8) She visits Doctor Joseph Wanless, creator of Lot-6 and the resulting superhumans, who implores Hollister to terminate Charlie before her powers become uncontrollable.
9) Hollister enlists fellow superhuman John Rainbird to assist her.

12) Charlie's powers overwhelm him and she sends a concussive burst of flames throughout the house.
13) Andy and Charlie escape into their truck.

16) After Charlie accidentally stumbles upon his paralyzed wife, Irv flies into a rage before conceding that he occasionally overreacts.

19) Charlie tells Irv, after speaking telepathically with his wife, that she forgives him for the accident that left her paralyzed, causing him to relent and attempt to protect Andy and Charlie when the police appear due to his prior emergency call.
20) Rainbird appears in the bushes, kills the policemen, and then shoots Irv in the knee before black trucks roll in to pick up Charlie and Andy.
21) Andy uses his push to trick Rainbird so Charlie can escape to a forest.
22) Charlie spends time honing her fire powers before stealing a bike and clothes to follow her father's telepathic message to her from his cell at DSI.
23) Charlie finds DSI and takes an agent's pass card from him, then kills him after he draws his gun to attack her.

instruction:

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) 26 years after the events of the first film, Dexter Reed has quit Good Burger in the hopes of becoming a successful entrepreneur, but his invention ideas turn out to be failures.
2) His latest invention, a spray that can make any material flame-retardant, backfires as he attempts to showcase the material on his own house in a demonstration for investors, including Mark Cuban, that ends up burning it down.
3) Left without a home and business, Dexter looks to move in with his sister Charlotte, but she refuses as she is one of his investors.
4) He then calls Ed, who still works at Good Burger and agrees to let him stay at his home.
5) Dexter visits Good Burger to find numerous new employees: two twins Cindy and Mindy; the elderly Ruth; Ed's son Ed 2, who looks and acts exactly like Ed; and Dexter's niece Mia, Charlotte's daughter who wants nothing to do with Dexter.
6) The restaurant has a new manager named Mr. Jensen.
7) In addition to working as the cashier, Ed is now the owner due to his love of the restaurant.
8) The only familiar employee is Fizz, whom Ed had accidentally left in the freezer for 22 years and is thawed out.
9) At Ed's home, Dexter meets Ed's family: his wife Edie and their numerous other children who look like Ed and are named after condiments.
10) Dexter is shocked to find that Roxanne, who previously tried to seduce Ed for the recipe for his sauce for Mondo Burger, now works as their nanny.
11) Dexter decides to work at Good Burger again while considering his next entrepreneurial venture.
12) When he pitches his permanent ice idea to Mia, she laughs it off.
13) Meanwhile, Ed has been hounded by Cecil McNevin, a lawyer for the conglomerate MegaCorp, to turn Good Burger into a global franchise, but Ed is uncertain.
14) MegaCorp sends a pair of goons to force Ed into signing the agreement, but Ed's natural clumsiness gets them hurt.
15) Cecil tries to appeal to Dexter, explaining their intent is to expand Good Burger but not to take it away from Ed and are planning to give the employees big raises.
16) Dexter considers it based on the financial benefit and then brings Ed to lunch with Cecil to explain the deal and they both agree to sign.
17) At the franchise launch party, Cecil reveals that the flagship store is being shut down with their employees being fired as mandated by the contract, which Dexter and Ed had failed to read before signing.
18) With everyone turning against Dexter, he takes Ed to MegaCorp headquarters to demand they reinstate the flagship restaurant and rehire the employees.
19) They meet with the CEO Katt Bozwell, the sister of former Mondo Burger owner Kurt Bozwell who wants revenge on Good Burger after sending Kurt away to prison.
20) She is planning to rebrand the restaurant Mega Good Burger and has plans to replace all employees with robot versions of Ed.
21) After destroying the Good Burger car, MegaCorp sends them home in a self-driving delivery car which Katt sends out of control to get rid of them.
22) Dexter forces the car to drive in a circle until it runs out of power.
23) Lamenting his failures, Dexter gets Ed to rally the Good Burger employees to stop the launch of Mega Good Burger.
24) They plan to infiltrate MegaCorp headquarters so Mia, a computer expert, can shut down the machines before the launch.
25) While Dexter, Ed, and Mia infiltrate the building, the other employees create a distraction, but their ruse is uncovered.
26) Dexter and Ed get separated from Mia and find the control room while Mia is trapped on a conveyor belt.
27) Dexter goes off to find Mia, leaving Ed to shut down the restaurants.
28) Dexter saves Mia, but they are captured and taken to the control room where Ed is also taken.
29) As Katt gives the first demonstration on national television, the robotic Ed throws food at her, followed by the other machines shooting food at everyone at every location around the world.
30) Ed had decided reprogramming the machines to go haywire would be better.
31) In the aftermath, MegaCorp is shut down and Ed is given back ownership of the original Good Burger.
32) Charlotte comes to visit Dexter and Mia and Dexter is allowed to apologize to her.
33) Ed and Ed 2 reveal to Dexter that they figured out how to make permanent ice and Good Burger successfully sells it to Mark Cuban, making $10,000,000.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 7.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 14.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 22.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 20.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 27.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

The story arc type can be classified as "Rags to Riches" because the protagonist starts in a disadvantaged situation (4), faces challenges and setbacks (drops to 3 at the fourth turning point), but ultimately ends in a much better situation (8). The overall trend is an improvement from the start to the end, despite the setbacks in between. This pattern matches the "Rags to Riches" story arc, where the protagonist's condition improves from the first turning point to the last turning point.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Our narrative unfolds with Tom Fisher, a worldly explorer sporting a mesmerizing olivine gaze intensified by a beard kissed by sea salt.
2) His unmatched expertise in the realm of cryptic puzzles and historical mysteries has earned him quite a name in the sea-faring community.
3) Immersed in yellowing maps and artifacts gathered from the four corners of the globe, Tom spends countless candlelit nights poring over the cryptic etchings of a legendary gem, christened the Ocean's Heart due to its striking blue-green hue.
4) Inspired and intrigued by the grandeur associated with the gem, Tom brings together a team as diverse as the seas themselves.
5) This includes sturdy seafarers christened by brine, adept deep-sea divers, Stacy Thompson, a strong-willed woman adept in naval navigation serving as his deputy, and Richard Davenport, a polished man who carries his reputation as an adept financier with an air of grace.
6) Aboard the steadfast vessel christened 'Sundance', Tom, in a rousing address, announces their planned expedition - to extract the Ocean's Heart from the sunken crypt of 'Elara’, a fabled ship shrouded in aquatic vegetation and darkness, undisturbed for millennia.
7) While preparations for the voyage are underway, Richard Davenport maintains an unnerving silence, speaking only into his phone or behind closed doors, arousing suspicion among the crew.
8) The onboard tension escalates when Stacy picks up signs of Richard secretly conspiring to claim the Ocean's Heart for his selfish motives.
9) As they commence their expedition under a clear, azure sky, they face the wrath of churning seas and the constant threat of marauders lurking on the misty maritime horizon.
10) Stacy, wary of Richard's stealthy activities, draws on her years of grasping psychic assessments, surreptitiously gathering data to thwart his treacherous intentions.
11) After weeks of batting against nature's fury, analysing sonar data, and adjusting navigational routes, they find the final resting place of 'Elara’, veiled by the cloak of numerous aquatic species.
12) Fearless divers triple-check their gear, drawing strength from their training as they plunge into the depths of the hypnotic blue ether.
13) They swim amidst a rainbow of fish until they glimpse the heart-stopping sight of the illustrious Ocean's Heart, ensconced in a delicate mantlet of corals and oysters.
14) Richard, seeing that the gem is reachable, unveils his nefarious plot to a select group of crew members, sowing the seeds of mutiny amidst looming danger.
15) Accompanied by his recruits, Richard dives into the silent deep, ambushing the unsuspecting divers.
16) Using cunning and ruthlessness, he seizes the coveted prize.
17) As he resurfaces with the loot, Richard sets off an extensive series of explosions aboard 'Sundance', using the black plumes of smoke as a diversion for his wicked agenda.
18) The chain reaction set off by the explosions inadvertently disrupts a dormant fault line in the ocean floor, triggering a massive underwater earthquake, followed by the rising swell of a catastrophic tsunami.
19) The explosion shatters the relative tranquility of the ship.
20) Pandemonium reigns as disoriented crew members scramble to find shelter amidst a crumbling ship.
21) Mustering their courage, Tom, Stacy, and those still holding onto their wits rush to the relatively unscathed sections of the splitting ship, bracing themselves against the terrifying sight of the towering wave closing in on them.
22) Sensing opportunity amidst chaos, a rogue faction of pirates, lured by the apocalyptic spectacle, launches an attack on the beleaguered 'Sundance'.
23) The brutal skirmish that ensues plunges Tom's team into further despair, leaving them weary yet resolute.
24) In this pandemonium, Richard sees an opportunity.
25) He boards a lifeboat, determined to flee, clutching the stolen shimmering gem.
26) However, he grievously miscalculates the wrath of the sea.
27) The tiny lifeboat stands no chance against the towering wall of water, and the merciless tsunami wave crashes into it.
28) As the massive wave rises and falls, it strips Richard of his ill-gotten gains.
29) Forced to relinquish his grip on the Ocean's Heart, he watches helplessly as it descends once again to the ocean floor.
30) Having survived the onslaught, the depleted crew gathers on their scarred vessel, their shared harrowing experiences binding them together as they unanimously agree to let the Ocean's Heart rest in peace.
31) Out of respect for the sea's might and recognising its rightful ownership of the gem, they decide not to disturb the aqueous peace again.
32) The final glimpse of the Ocean's Heart glinting at the ocean's bed, cradled in an ornate coral cradle, validates its true owner - the sea.
33) As 'Sundance' limps towards her port of call, the crew contemplates the life-altering adventure they've undergone, each lost in their world of thoughts.
34) They ponder the near-death experiences, the bitter battles they waged, and the havoc wrought by one precious gem, veiled in enchanting folklore.
35) The movie draws to a close with a voiceover that encapsulates the essence of their expedition— the undefeated spirit of exploration, unbreakable brotherhood, and a newfound reverence for the unpredictable sea.
36) The closing lines resonate, "The  Ocean's Heart has returned to its true owner.
37) The Sea."

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 8.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 11.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 17.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 28.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE
output:
### 1. Identify the Protagonist in the Story
The protagonist of the story is Tom Fisher, a worldly explorer.

### 2. First Turning Point (Opportunity)
The first turning point is at sentence 4: "Inspired and intrigued by the grandeur associated with the gem, Tom brings together a team as diverse as the seas themselves."
At this point, Tom's state is one of excitement and anticipation. He has a clear goal in mind (to find the Ocean's Heart) and is taking proactive steps to achieve it. His condition can be approximated as a 6 out of 10, as he is motivated and has a plan, but the challenges ahead are still unknown.

### 3. Second Turning Point (Change of Plans)
The second turning point is at sentence 8: "The onboard tension escalates when Stacy picks up signs of Richard secretly conspiring to claim the Ocean's Heart for his selfish motives."
Relative to the first turning point, Tom's situation has become more complicated. The introduction of a traitor within the team adds an element of danger and mistrust, potentially threatening the success of the expedition. Tom's condition can be approximated as a 4 out of 10, as the discovery of Richard's intentions introduces tension and uncertainty.

### 4. Third Turning Point (Point of No Return)
The third turning point is at sentence 11: "After weeks of batting against nature's fury, analysing sonar data, and adjusting navigational routes, they find the final resting place of 'Elara’, veiled by the cloak of numerous aquatic species."
At this point, Tom and his team have committed fully to their goal, overcoming significant obstacles to reach the location of the Ocean's Heart. Despite the challenges, they are closer to achieving their objective, which suggests a heightened sense of purpose and determination. Tom's condition can be approximated as a 7 out of 10, as they have made significant progress towards their goal.

### 5. Fourth Turning Point (Major Setback)
The fourth turning point is at sentence 17: "As he resurfaces with the loot, Richard sets off an extensive series of explosions aboard 'Sundance', using the black plumes of smoke as a diversion for his wicked agenda."
This event marks a significant setback for Tom. The explosions, the betrayal by Richard, and the subsequent chaos and danger (including the triggering of a tsunami) place Tom and his crew in a desperate and dangerous situation. Tom's condition can be approximated as a 2 out of 10, as they face immediate and severe threats to their survival.

### 6. Fifth Turning Point (Climax)
The fifth turning point is at sentence 28: "The tiny lifeboat stands no chance against the towering wall of water, and the merciless tsunami wave crashes into it."
At this point, Tom has lost the opportunity to claim the Ocean's Heart, but more importantly, he and his remaining crew are fighting for survival against the tsunami and its aftermath. However, the fact that Richard's plan is foiled and the Ocean's Heart is returned to the sea can be seen as a form of vindication or a positive outcome, given the crew's eventual decision to leave the gem be. Tom's condition can be approximated as a 5 out of 10, as while they have suffered greatly and failed to achieve their initial goal, they have also learned a valuable lesson and decided to respect the sea's power.

### 7. Protagonist's Condition List
Based on the analysis, the list of Tom's conditions at each turning point is: 6, 4, 7, 2, 5.

### 8. Classify the Story Arc Type
The story arc type can be classified based on the pattern of the protagonist's condition list. The list shows that Tom starts in a relatively good condition (6), faces complications and setbacks (dropping to 4 and then 2), but ultimately ends in a condition that, while not the highest, reflects a form of resolution and growth (ending at 5). This pattern, where the protagonist faces significant challenges, hits a low point, and then recovers to a point of resolution (though not necessarily achieving the original goal), aligns with the "Man in a Hole" story arc. The protagonist falls into a dilemma (the hole) but finds a way out, ending better than at the beginning in terms of personal growth and understanding, even if the external goal (retrieving the Ocean's Heart) is not achieved.

### 9. Determined Story Arc Type
Man in a Hole.

The fifth turning point is at sentence 28: "The tiny lifeboat stands no chance against the towering wall of water, and the merciless tsunami wave crashes into it."
At this point, Tom has lost the opportunity to claim the Ocean's Heart, but more importantly, he and his remaining crew are fighting for survival against the tsunami and its aftermath. However, the fact that Richard's plan is foiled and the Ocean's Heart is returned to the sea can be seen as a form of vindication or a positive outcome, given the crew's eventual decision to leave the gem be. Tom's condition can be approximated as a 5 out of 10, as while they have suffered greatly and failed to achieve their initial goal, they have also learned a valuable lesson and decided to respect the sea's power.

### 7. Protagonist's Condition List
Based on the analysis, the list of Tom's conditions at each turning point is: 6, 4, 7, 2, 5.

### 8. Classify the Story Arc Type
The story arc type can be classified based on the pattern of the protagonist's condition list. The list shows that Tom starts in a relatively good condition (6), faces complications and setbacks (dropping to 4 and then 2), but ultimately ends in a condition that, while not the highest, reflects a form of resolution and growth (ending at 5). This pattern, where the protagonist faces significant challenges, hits a low point, and then recovers to a point of resolution (though not necessarily achieving the original goal), aligns with the "Man in a Hole" story arc. The protagonist falls into a dilemma (the hole) but finds a way out, ending better than at the beginning in terms of personal growth and understanding, even if the external goal (retrieving the Ocean's Heart) is not achieved.

### 9. Determined Story Arc Type
Man in a Hole.

### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Our narrative unfolds with Tom Fisher, a worldly explorer sporting a mesmerizing olivine gaze intensified by a beard kissed by sea salt.
2) His unmatched expertise in the realm of cryptic puzzles and historical mysteries has earned him quite a name in the sea-faring community.
3) Immersed in yellowing maps and artifacts gathered from the four corners of the globe, Tom spends countless candlelit nights poring over the cryptic etchings of a legendary gem, christened the Ocean's Heart due to its striking blue-green hue.
4) Inspired and intrigued by the grandeur associated with the gem, Tom brings together a team as diverse as the seas themselves.
5) This includes sturdy seafarers christened by brine, adept deep-sea divers, Stacy Thompson, a strong-willed woman adept in naval navigation serving as his deputy, and Richard Davenport, a polished man who carries his reputation as an adept financier with an air of grace.
6) Aboard the steadfast vessel christened 'Sundance', Tom, in a rousing address, announces their planned expedition - to extract the Ocean's Heart from the sunken crypt of 'Elara’, a fabled ship shrouded in aquatic vegetation and darkness, undisturbed for millennia.
7) While preparations for the voyage are underway, Richard Davenport maintains an unnerving silence, speaking only into his phone or behind closed doors, arousing suspicion among the crew.
8) The onboard tension escalates when Stacy picks up signs of Richard secretly conspiring to claim the Ocean's Heart for his selfish motives.
9) As they commence their expedition under a clear, azure sky, they face the wrath of churning seas and the constant threat of marauders lurking on the misty maritime horizon.
10) Stacy, wary of Richard's stealthy activities, draws on her years of grasping psychic assessments, surreptitiously gathering data to thwart his treacherous intentions.
11) After weeks of batting against nature's fury, analysing sonar data, and adjusting navigational routes, they find the final resting place of 'Elara’, veiled by the cloak of numerous aquatic species.
12) Fearless divers triple-check their gear, drawing strength from their training as they plunge into the depths of the hypnotic blue ether.
13) They swim amidst a rainbow of fish until they glimpse the heart-stopping sight of the illustrious Ocean's Heart, ensconced in a delicate mantlet of corals and oysters.
14) Richard, seeing that the gem is reachable, unveils his nefarious plot to a select group of crew members, sowing the seeds of mutiny amidst looming danger.
15) Accompanied by his recruits, Richard dives into the silent deep, ambushing the unsuspecting divers.
16) Using cunning and ruthlessness, he seizes the coveted prize.
17) As he resurfaces with the loot, Richard sets off an extensive series of explosions aboard 'Sundance', using the black plumes of smoke as a diversion for his wicked agenda.
18) The chain reaction set off by the explosions inadvertently disrupts a dormant fault line in the ocean floor, triggering a massive underwater earthquake, followed by the rising swell of a catastrophic tsunami.
19) The explosion shatters the relative tranquility of the ship.
20) Pandemonium reigns as disoriented crew members scramble to find shelter amidst a crumbling ship.
21) Mustering their courage, Tom, Stacy, and those still holding onto their wits rush to the relatively unscathed sections of the splitting ship, bracing themselves against the terrifying sight of the towering wave closing in on them.
22) Sensing opportunity amidst chaos, a rogue faction of pirates, lured by the apocalyptic spectacle, launches an attack on the beleaguered 'Sundance'.
23) The brutal skirmish that ensues plunges Tom's team into further despair, leaving them weary yet resolute.
24) In this pandemonium, Richard sees an opportunity.
25) He boards a lifeboat, determined to flee, clutching the stolen shimmering gem.
26) However, he grievously miscalculates the wrath of the sea.
27) The tiny lifeboat stands no chance against the towering wall of water, and the merciless tsunami wave crashes into it.
28) As the massive wave rises and falls, it strips Richard of his ill-gotten gains.
29) Forced to relinquish his grip on the Ocean's Heart, he watches helplessly as it descends once again to the ocean floor.
30) Having survived the onslaught, the depleted crew gathers on their scarred vessel, their shared harrowing experiences binding them together as they unanimously agree to let the Ocean's Heart rest in peace.
31) Out of respect for the sea's might and recognising its rightful ownership of the gem, they decide not to disturb the aqueous peace again.
32) The final glimpse of the Ocean's Heart glinting at the ocean's bed, cradled in an ornate coral cradle, validates its true owner - the sea.
33) As 'Sundance' limps towards her port of call, the crew contemplates the life-altering adventure they've undergone, each lost in their world of thoughts.
34) They ponder the near-death experiences, the bitter battles they waged, and the havoc wrought by one precious gem, veiled in enchanting folklore.
35) The movie draws to a close with a voiceover that encapsulates the essence of their expedition— the undefeated spirit of exploration, unbreakable brotherhood, and a newfound reverence for the unpredictable sea.
36) The closing lines resonate, "The  Ocean's Heart has returned to its true owner.
37) The Sea."

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 4.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 8.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 11.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 17.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 28.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie unfolds on a serene morning in John Thompson's contemporary loft-style apartment located in downtown Seattle.
2) This 25-year-old software developer, employed by a high-profile tech company, is seen gearing up for another day of work from his minimalist home office.
3) As the camera pans across the room, the spectators get a glimpse of John's introverted personality.
4) Today, like every other day, he artfully dodges potential social interactions.
5) His social anxiety takes a prominent stand when he is seen shopping at Walmart's round-the-clock grocery store.
6) The task of ordering pizza for dinner from Domino's becomes an ordeal for him.
7) The cautious excitement seen during the arrival of an Amazon parcel delivers a similar message.
8) Brief, intense flashbacks reminisce into the disconcertingly silent world that is John's solitude.
9) John's perpetual loneliness paints a monotone picture.
10) In an unexpected turn of events, while exploring a Reddit forum post-midnight, John stumbles upon 'Unseen Chains,' an online support group committed to aiding individuals grappling with severe social phobias.
11) A dramatic internal debate rages within John.
12) The brave display of determination takes place when John, overcoming his deep-seated reservations, clicks on the 'Join' button of the digital support group.
13) As the newest member of 'Unseen Chains,' John still clings to his comfort zone, choosing to remain an unnoticed observer during the group's virtual Zoom therapy sessions.
14) Gradually, an evident shift occurs in his demeanor.
15) Bearing his soul, he stages a profound verbal plunge, opening up about his fears and experiences.
16) As time progresses, the introduction of a new character occurs, Sarah, a vibrant and charismatic therapist known for her pioneering cognitive-behavioral therapy techniques from Chicago.
17) Sarah suggests taking a leap of faith and proposes a real-life meetup at a local library for the group members.
18) The dramatic scene of John's consent to the idea is portrayed through a heated conversation he has with himself in the mirror.
19) The day of reckoning arrives.
20) With his anxiety visibly peeking, and armed with nothing but sheer willpower, John steps out of his apartment, heading for the most-awaited meetup at the city's public library.

25) Sarah's empathetic approach, coupled with her expertise in cognitive behavior therapy, helps John to start confronting his deeply ingrained fears and anxieties.
26) As Sarah introduces him to systematic desensitization strategies and real-world exposure techniques, John gradually witnesses the world outside his apartment through a less fear-tinted lens.
27) John is shown making small yet significant strides in his fight against his social anxiety.
28) A significant leap manifests when John, in a bold move, organizes a second group meeting at a favorite local cafe.
29) He sends out invites to all members of 'Unseen Chains,' thereby proving his progressing control over his social phobia.
30) The second meetup displays an evident improvement from the first one.
31) Just before reaching the end credits, a quiet moment is shown where John reflects on his transformation.
32) He acknowledges his journey to manage his triggers and develop a more healthy way to connect with others.
33) The closing scene presents a flourishing and happier John.
34) He is seen confidently attending a tech meetup in the city's convention center, interacting freely with fellow tech enthusiasts.
35) The spectators are given a glimpse of John's acquired social skill arsenal.
36) The last scene of John sharing a warm and genuine laugh with a group of fellow tech enthusiasts at the convention center, stands as a testament to John's incredible journey of self-discovery.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) A space capsule crashes back to Earth near Roswell, New Mexico; Dr. Linda Murphy, answering to National Security Advisor Ethan Marcos, takes control of the investigation.
2) The craft is found to be from ELBE, a secret U.S.-Soviet space program that aimed to end the Cold War via establishing a joint first contact.
3) Linda's father, Noah, was a lead scientist on the project, but they became estranged when he sent Abraham, a chimpanzee the young Linda befriended, into space as the capsule's pilot.
4) The mission was declared a failure when Earth lost contact with the craft in 2007.
5) Marcos orders Linda to investigate the site before the Russians learn of the capsule's return.
6) Linda and her friend, Undersecretary Reynolds, lead a team to the crash site.
7) They discover that the capsule's occupant broke out following the landing, and the capsule is covered in a strange green fluid.
8) Abraham, having grown several times larger, appears and kills Reynolds and the soldiers.
9) Linda trips and is knocked unconscious, but sees another team led by her former classmate Eva Kuleshov, who is now a Russian agent, arrive and tranquilize Abraham.
10) Unnoticed by the humans, a Gila monster consumes some of the liquid at the site.
11) At the Langley Research Center, Abraham is confined while Linda, Eva and a team of scientists attempt to understand his mutation.
12) Back at the crash site, a group of soldiers left to guard the capsule are killed by the now-mutated, gigantic Dinosaur-like Gila.
13) Marcos sends Linda and her assistant Jones to pursue the creature.
14) Meanwhile, Eva discovers that the alien substance breaks down in Earth's atmosphere, leading her to covertly have the entire remaining supply injected into Abraham to stabilize it.
15) Linda and Jones witness the Gila destroy a bridge and a passenger train before heading underground.
16) Abraham grows even larger and escapes from Langley.
17) Linda, confused over his sudden further mutation, meets with Marcos and Eva, with Eva mentioning rumors that Abraham destroyed the Extraterrestrial Defense Initiative, a successor to the Strategic Defense Initiative.
18) It is found that Abraham inhaled the substance over time while in the capsule, while the Gila directly consumed it.
19) General Delaney, Reynolds' successor, orders the team to find the monsters as soon as possible.
20) They track Abraham to Huntington, West Virginia, where Linda discovers the substance breaking down in blood he left behind, forcing Eva to admit her deception.
21) Linda removes Eva from the team and joins a group of Special Forces soldiers who engage Abraham, but the men are all killed and Abraham flees.
22) Eva disappears with an Apache helicopter.
23) Returning to Langley, Linda and Jones discover beams of cosmic energy transmitted from the Andromeda Galaxy are remotely controlling both monsters via the substance in their bodies.
24) The Hubble Space Telescope discovers an alien ship approaching Earth, forcing Marcos to call Noah in to provide assistance.
25) Linda finds that Abraham may be able to resist the aliens' control, and she, Jones and Noah plan to jam the alien signal using a transmitter.
26) The transmitter is attached to the Washington Monument shortly before Abraham appears in the city, guided there to decapitate the U.S. government in preparation for a full-scale invasion.
27) Its jamming signal quickly frees him, but the Gila monster is unaffected and emerges to wreak havoc.
28) Despite Abraham no longer being a threat, Delaney orders a missile strike on him; this accidentally causes the Washington Monument to fall, killing Delaney and destroying the transmitter, thus allowing the aliens to regain control of Abraham.
29) Noah, having reconciled with Linda, discloses the existence of a prototype transmitter stored in a van in the city, and sends Linda and Jones to retrieve it.
30) They find it, but Jones is devoured by the Gila before she can repair it.
31) Upon its activation, Abraham is once again freed, and he battles the Gila to protect Linda.
32) The Gila eventually gains the advantage over Abraham, but Eva is able to disorient the Gila with a suicide attack.
33) Abraham recovers and beats the Gila, striking it several times before killing it by snapping its neck.
34) Marcos sends in gunships to terminate Abraham, but changes his mind and decides to place faith in Linda's trust of Abraham, calling them off at the last minute.
35) In the aftermath, the alien ship retreats from Earth, while the fallen Gila's energy is fully neutralized.
36) Abraham is sent to a facility outside Santa Fe, New Mexico, where he can live in peace.
37) Marcos gives Linda exclusive rights to study him, and she accepts Noah's offer to join her.

- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 3.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 11.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 20.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 28.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 34.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 2001, Michael Ausiello, a writer for TV Guide, is brought to a gay nightclub by his best friend in Manhattan.
2) There, he meets photographer Kit Cowan, and the two instantly connect.
3) As they begin dating, Michael struggles with his insecurities of not being attractive enough for Kit, previously being overweight.
4) Kit reveals that he had an affair.
5) They both admit their fears of being in a long-term relationship since neither of them had been in one before, but they decide to continue dating.
6) During their first Christmas together, Kit gives Michael his own closet space at his apartment.
7) One year later, Kit gets an appendectomy.
8) His parents, Bob and Marilyn, come to Manhattan, and Kit has yet to come out to them.
9) Marilyn grows suspicious of Michael.
10) After she incessantly interrogates him, Kit comes out to his parents and reveals that Michael is his boyfriend.
11) While initially upset that Kit could not admit this to her, Marilyn is accepting and welcomes Michael.
12) Michael and Kit continue their relationship and move into a townhouse together.
13) During their second Christmas, Kit joins Michael in lying under the Christmas tree with him as Michael explains it was a childhood fantasy of his to do it every year with his partner.
14) In 2013, Michael and Kit develop complications in their relationship as their sex life deteriorates.
15) Michael spends too much time with his company TVLine and becomes an alcoholic.
16) He also suspects Kit is having an affair with his coworker, Sebastian.
17) Their therapist believes they now resent each other, but they still love each other enough to not want to end it.
18) He suggests that they separate to reassess their feelings.
19) Kit moves out, but the two remain in their relationship.
20) During their thirteenth Christmas, Kit begins showing signs of ill health.
21) In 2014, Kit is diagnosed with a rare form of stage-4 neuroendocrine cancer.
22) Michael, still traumatized by his mother's death from cancer, moves Kit back in and the two reconcile.
23) Michael supports Kit as he undergoes treatment.
24) Kit's health worsens and is given six weeks left to live.
25) Michael apologizes to Kit for not letting him know how beautiful he was due to his fears of being left for a more attractive man.
26) Kit apologizes to Michael for having an affair with Sebastian.
27) Kit proposes to Michael and they marry the next day.
28) The two spend their last Christmas together, with Michael fantasizing himself and Kit growing old and lying under the Christmas tree together.
29) In 2015, Kit is taken to the hospital.
30) As Kit nears death, Michael allows Sebastian to say goodbye to him.
31) As Kit is dying, Michael fantasizes interviewing Kit as a departing actor whose character is being killed off a television show.
32) Kit expresses gratitude for his "time on the show" and is looking forward to the future.
33) Michael asks Kit what he should do, and Kit assures him that he will figure it out.
34) Back in reality, Michael thanks Kit for giving him a family.
35) After Kit's death, Michael continues to be a part of Bob and Marilyn's lives.
36) Michael prepares to leave New York for Los Angeles.
37) As he's nervous to start his new journey, he remembers how brave he was to begin his adventure with Kit.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:

3) As they begin dating, Michael struggles with his insecurities of not being attractive enough for Kit, previously being overweight.
4) Kit reveals that he had an affair.
5) They both admit their fears of being in a long-term relationship since neither of them had been in one before, but they decide to continue dating.
6) During their first Christmas together, Kit gives Michael his own closet space at his apartment.
7) One year later, Kit gets an appendectomy.
8) His parents, Bob and Marilyn, come to Manhattan, and Kit has yet to come out to them.
9) Marilyn grows suspicious of Michael.
10) After she incessantly interrogates him, Kit comes out to his parents and reveals that Michael is his boyfriend.
11) While initially upset that Kit could not admit this to her, Marilyn is accepting and welcomes Michael.
12) Michael and Kit continue their relationship and move into a townhouse together.
13) During their second Christmas, Kit joins Michael in lying under the Christmas tree with him as Michael explains it was a childhood fantasy of his to do it every year with his partner.
14) In 2013, Michael and Kit develop complications in their relationship as their sex life deteriorates.
15) Michael spends too much time with his company TVLine and becomes an alcoholic.
16) He also suspects Kit is having an affair with his coworker, Sebastian.
17) Their therapist believes they now resent each other, but they still love each other enough to not want to end it.
18) He suggests that they separate to reassess their feelings.
19) Kit moves out, but the two remain in their relationship.
20) During their thirteenth Christmas, Kit begins showing signs of ill health.
21) In 2014, Kit is diagnosed with a rare form of stage-4 neuroendocrine cancer.
22) Michael, still traumatized by his mother's death from cancer, moves Kit back in and the two reconcile.
23) Michael supports Kit as he undergoes treatment.
24) Kit's health worsens and is given six weeks left to live.
25) Michael apologizes to Kit for not letting him know how beautiful he was due to his fears of being left for a more attractive man.
