### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In 1998 Los Angeles, Winona lives with her parents, has dropped out of college and works for her father as his secretary.
2) Her relationship with her father Richard and mother Pamela isn't great.
3) Winona’s best friends are Addie and Stephanie.
4) She also has a boyfriend, Frank.
5) Winona goes out with Addie, Cameron (Addie's boyfriend), Stephanie, and Frank.
6) Frank leaves them to get food and doesn’t return.
7) Upset, Winona considers being done with Frank.
8) Later, they see a group of young men where Winona meets Ben.
9) One day Winona visits her pediatrician Dr. Cotton due to pain in her armpit which had lasted for a month.
10) Dr. Cotton does an examination of her and determines she may have an anxiety disorder and suggests she visit a therapist.
11) Winona visits therapist, Dr. Monroe.
12) During the session, Dr. Monroe asks her about her relationship with her mother which causes Winona to break down into tears.
13) Winona begins dating Ben, and he invites her to his place where he lives with his roommate/ex-girlfriend Jen.
14) They are hosting a party for Jen’s mom.
15) Winona accidentally wishes Jen’s mom a happy birthday, which leads to everyone gasping and Ben having to explain to Winona that Jen’s mom had her cancer go into remission a year ago.
16) Winona is humiliated and asks Ben to help sneak her out.
17) Winona starts to attend group therapy sessions with Dr. Monroe and other people.
18) She doesn’t feel that she needs to be there and sees it as a waste of time.
19) Pamela and Richard plan to downsize.
20) They ask Winona to move out and find her own place.
21) She is annoyed but decides to start looking for her own place and a job.
22) She applies to her favorite book store, as well as a clothing store.
23) However, when she has to do an interview at the clothing store, Winona begins to suffer a panic attack.
24) In a daze, she grabs lip gloss and applies it before collapsing.
25) The interviewer calls Pamela to get Winona.
26) Winona tells Stephanie about the panic attack, but she appears to have a callous attitude towards it.
27) At work, Winona realizes she forgot to give her dad a file.
28) She goes to the parking garage and sees Richard leaving with another woman.
29) Thinking he is having an affair, Winona attempts to drive after him, but she gets worried since she only has a learners permit, and she unsuccessfully tries to get a stranger to ride with her.
30) Later, Winona has another attempt at following her dad, but she gets distracted from talking to herself and she rear ends the woman’s car.
31) Richard steps out and isn’t mad, but more concerned when he sees that Winona suffered a minor head injury.
32) She declines to get help from the hospital.
33) Richard explains that the woman is a real estate agent showing him other houses.
34) Ben takes Winona out on a date.
35) He later invites her to meet his mother Hayley, whom Ben says also has bouts of anxiety attacks.
36) Winona ends up having an uncomfortable conversation with Hayley.
37) Winona has lunch with her parents, who are talking about the new house they found.
38) Winona is excited to move there but Richard and Pamela make it clear that the place is only for the two of them.
39) Winona gets angry at them and storms off.
40) She later joins Ben and suggests that they move in together since he also wants to move away from Jen, but Ben says that he doesn’t think it will work out between them because he plans to be a doctor and thinks his life is moving in a different direction from Winona’s.
41) She angrily tells him off before deciding to walk home.
42) When Winona gets home, she begins to suffer another panic attack.
43) It becomes more intense and uncontrollable, and she can’t go into her room without vomiting.
44) Pamela and Richard find Winona in their bedroom crying, where she starts to blame them for why she is like this since they never got her treatment when she needed it, as well as them selling the house and forcing her to move out.
45) They take her to Dr. Cotton, who gives Winona a pill to treat her anxiety.
46) Richard then admits that he once suffered a panic attack after Winona was born, but he and Pamela agree to help Winona get through this.
47) Winona starts to get her life back on track.
48) She plans to go back to college and writes to her professor on returning back.
49) She also maintains her friendship with Addie and Stephanie.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 5.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 10.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 16.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 25.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 43.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Hollywood actor Nicolas "Nick" Cage is struggling with his career after being passed over for several major film roles and is constantly pestered and tormented by "Nicky", who appears to him as his younger (and more successful) self.
2) His relationship with his ex-wife Olivia and daughter Addy is also marred by years of emotional neglect.
3) Losing a key film role and following an embarrassing event at Addy's birthday party, Nick plans to retire from acting.
4) He decides to accept a vague offer of $1 million from his agent Richard Fink that involves going to Majorca to meet billionaire playboy Javi Gutierrez and to be the guest of honor at his birthday.
5) Upon meeting Javi, Nick is initially annoyed by his neediness and insistence that they create an improvisational movie based on a script he wrote, but is soon inspired by Javi's determination, and the two of them quickly bond over their surprisingly shared love of films such as The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari and Paddington 2 (the latter of which Nick watches for the first time with Javi).
6) Soon after, Nick is confronted by CIA agents Vivian and Martin.
7) They suspect that Javi, who they claim made his fortune through arms dealing, is behind the kidnapping of Maria, the daughter of a Catalan anti-crime politician, with the hope that he will drop out of an upcoming election.
8) Nick insists that his acting instincts would've detected if Javi was a criminal, but he eventually decides to help the CIA with the mission.
9) After successfully rigging the cameras in Javi's compound, Nick attends a party where he announces his collaboration with Javi on a new movie, as an excuse to stay on the compound long enough to find Maria.
10) After a misadventure involving LSD, Nick and Javi decide that their movie should be about their relationship.
11) Nick later discovers that Javi keeps a shrine room dedicated to all of his movies, including a wax figure of his character Castor Troy from the film Face/Off, complete with identical golden pistols.
12) Vivian suggests that Nick includes a kidnapping in their script, to get Javi's reaction to it.
13) Nick explains his new idea to Javi, who believes that Nick is distracted by his family issues.
14) Vivian tells Nick to flee, or possibly kill Javi, as Javi has discovered their plot.
15) But Javi reveals he's brought Nick's family to his villa.
16) Nick tries to make amends with them, but they reject his appeal and accuse him of prioritizing his film career over his family.
17) Javi privately goes to meet with his cousin Lucas, who is revealed to be the true arms dealer and the one who kidnapped Maria.
18) Lucas warns him that Nick is working with the CIA and pressures him to kill Nick, or else Lucas will kill Javi.
19) Nick and Javi face off, but neither can bring himself to kill the other.
20) Lucas sends his men after both of them, and they race back to the house to discover that Addy has been kidnapped.
21) Nick takes Javi, Olivia and Javi's assistant Gabriela to the CIA safe house, only for the house to have been compromised; Martin has been killed, while Vivian sacrifices herself to kill Lucas's men before they can ambush the group.
22) With Javi's help, Nick and Olivia pose as a reclusive criminal couple to get close to Lucas.
23) He figures out their plan, but they still manage to escape with Addy and Maria.
24) Nick, Addy, Olivia and Maria race to the American embassy while Javi and Gabriela stay behind to delay Lucas's pursuit.
25) Upon arrival, Lucas holds Nick at gunpoint, but Addy tosses him a knife which Nick uses to kill him—transitioning into the movie that Nick and Javi completed, presumably based on their adventure.
26) Nick is applauded for his new film and congratulates Javi before going home with his family to watch Paddington 2, now with a better relationship.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 3.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 7.5 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 13.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 19.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 25.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) John and Casper are twin siblings, gifted with the same exact striking blue eyes and freckly countenance as if stamped from the same mold.
2) Born and raised in the largely unremarkable small town of Springfield, Missouri, their physical resemblance belies their contrasting personas and physiques.
3) John is chiseled and muscular, a regular at The Pump Iron gyms of Springfield.
4) His broad shoulders and well-defined muscles instill awe in fellow weightlifters and onlookers alike, coupled with a stoic and disciplined persona, he becomes an aspirational icon for many.
5) Casper, on the other hand, is a tall skinny chap with a smile forever playing on his lips.
6) Known as the 'King of Comedy' in the Springfield Community Theatre circle, he never failed to get a laugh from his even most somber of audience members.
7) Despite their contrasting characters, the bond they share is deeply rooted and unshakeable, and they stand resolutely united against any challenge life throws at them.
8) One day everything changes when a letter postmarked from a nondescript New York address crosses their paths.
9) The envelope was unremarkable, but it's what was inside that sent their lives spiraling in unforeseen directions.
10) The envelope contained a letter laden with cryptic riddles and abstract clues, hinting towards a secret background to their birth - a far from conventional past with implications that they never could have imagined.
11) Such cryptic revelations spark their curiosity.
12) The world they lived in was suddenly not the only world there was – there was more to it, more specifically, there was more to them.
13) Standing resolute, they embark on a journey, pool their strengths, and focus on solving the unparalleled mystery which collectively is their past.
14) With their newfound revelation, they stumble upon the existence of a secret genetic research facility, the 'GenTech Labs', unsuspected and hidden from the public eye.
15) Their relentless investigation leads them across the paths of Dr. Elias Stern, a retired scientist who once was the lead researcher at the 'GenTech Labs.'
16) Caving in under the weight of his conscience, Dr. Stern confesses to manipulating genetic codes as a part of his research in a relentless pursuit to create 'flawless' offspring.
17) John and Casper, he reveals, were the cherished results of his secret and ethically questionable experiment.
18) As they grapple with the shocking realization of their unique existence, Dr. Stern drops another bombshell, shaking their world further.
19) He discloses that John and Casper are not the lone results of his experiment.
20) There exist more genetically-engineered 'special' children out there, just like them.
21) Dr. Stern admits that his guilt had led him to develop an antidote, a complex mix of genetic codes that could reverse the genetic modifications, essentially reverting them to ordinary humans.
22) The catch though, the genetic code is locked up under stringent security at the still operational 'GenTech Labs,' where only a select few are granted access.
23) Faced with the cataclysm that was their life and the revelation that their 'specialness' was a contrived lie, John and Casper make the brave decision to confront their past head-on.
24) In a bid to reclaim their original genetic blueprint, they draw on their genetically engineered capabilities—John's advanced strength and Casper’s enhanced intellect.
25) Arming themselves with as much knowledge as possible from Dr. Stern’s old lab files and secret interactions with other genetically modified siblings, they meticulously plan their daring mission to infiltrate 'GenTech Labs.'
26) Prepared and resolved, they implement their plan, sneaking into the ‘GenTech Labs.’  Capitalizing on his Herculean strength, John plows through the physical barriers and neutralizes the security forces standing between them and their goal.
27) Meanwhile, Casper’s ultra-sharp intellect shines in this showdown, as he successfully decodes and breaks down the facility’s advanced security systems ensuring their safe infiltration.
28) Their shared focus, combined strengths and unique abilities pave their way across the heavily guarded compound, while they remain inconspicuous to the security staff.
29) After navigating through the lab's complex network of rooms, passing several unprecedented challenges, they finally retrieve the deeply secured antidote.
30) With the genetic formula that holds the promise of restoring their artificially mutated DNA in their possession, they allow themselves a sigh of relief.
31) The harrowing journey through 'GenTech Labs' has ended.
32) Administering the antidote, they instantly feel themselves transforming, the synthetic enhancements fading away and replaced by a more organic feel.
33) Their artificially enhanced DNA structure gradually resets back to its original blueprint aligning more with their inherent human features, bringing them a sense of peace they had not felt in a while.
34) This ordeal teaches them to accept and appreciate their ordinary selves, helping them in finding joy in the simplicity of being regular human beings.
35) Under the breaking dawn, they return home on Spruce Street to the community that embraces them no matter what their past holds.
36) Their journey has not only removed unnecessary enhancements from their lives but also helped reshape their perspective on life.
37) They resume their daily lives, now with a much deeper appreciation of their bond and newfound awareness and acceptance of their identity.
38) Their roller-coaster ride of a journey brings them closer than ever, making their bond stronger and more harmonious.
39) They come to realize that the sense of adequacy they sought lies not in the 'enhancements,' but in their simple existence, their shared past, and experiences.
40) Their rekindled unity and shared experiences take preeminence over their differences, helping them cherish their unique yet ordinary connection rooted in trust, respect, and love.
41) John chooses to return to Pump Iron gym, but now he carries an appreciation for human strength rather than the superhuman strength he once flaunted.
42) As for Casper, he lights up the stage once again with his infectious humor, but not as a trick of his genetically programmed mind, but as a testament of his natural talent.
43) His comedy act carries the crowd into waves of laughter, his wit and humor now reflecting innate charisma rather than altered genes.
44) Their once pre-programmed life now feels like a journey filled with spontaneous decisions where they can exercise free-will, bringing them joy, excitement, and a sense of liberation.
45) Embracing each day as it comes, they cherish their humble, ordinary existence, taking pride in the shared past they have overcome.
46) They take an oath to stand by each other, prepared to cross any hurdles and face any storms life had in store for them.
47) The deep-seated fraternal bond they share stands as a beacon of resilience and strength for both of them, paving the pathway for their future.
48) Believing that life should be lived on their terms, they inspire their community through their journey, symbolizing a beacon of strength in the face of adversity.
49) Their past experiences, once shrouded in darkness and mystery, are now reminders of the strength they possess and their potential to overcome it all.
50) With their troubled past behind them, John and Casper relish in the joy of being reborn into the simplicity of normality, appreciating their distinct identities.
51) Despite the hurdles and struggles they faced together, they find solace in their shared experiences, finding strength in unity while cherishing their individual and mutual triumphs.
52) Their epic journey made them realize that their unique identities are not determined purely by their genetic gifts but by their shared experience, courage, and unshakeable bond.
53) As our story comes to a close, the tale of a journey to self-discovery and acceptance leaves a lingering thought on the beauty of unity and the divine beauty in being ordinary.
54) As night falls, the brothers bid adieu to the world, standing proud of their humble beginnings, their convergence on an epic journey to discover the unyielding strength of the human spirit that brooks no defeat.

Story Arc Types:

- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)

- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

- Change of Plans (tp2): 8.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 18.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 22.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 32.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

44) Their once pre-programmed life now feels like a journey filled with spontaneous decisions where they can exercise free-will, bringing them joy, excitement, and a sense of liberation.
45) Embracing each day as it comes, they cherish their humble, ordinary existence, taking pride in the shared past they have overcome.
46) They take an oath to stand by each other, prepared to cross any hurdles and face any storms life had in store for them.
47) The deep-seated fraternal bond they share stands as a beacon of resilience and strength for both of them, paving the pathway for their future.
48) Believing that life should be lived on their terms, they inspire their community through their journey, symbolizing a beacon of strength in the face of adversity.
49) Their past experiences, once shrouded in darkness and mystery, are now reminders of the strength they possess and their potential to overcome it all.
50) With their troubled past behind them, John and Casper relish in the joy of being reborn into the simplicity of normality, appreciating their distinct identities.
51) Despite the hurdles and struggles they faced together, they find solace in their shared experiences, finding strength in unity while cherishing their individual and mutual triumphs.
52) Their epic journey made them realize that their unique identities are not determined purely by their genetic gifts but by their shared experience, courage, and unshakeable bond.
53) As our story comes to a close, the tale of a journey to self-discovery and acceptance leaves a lingering thought on the beauty of unity and the divine beauty in being ordinary.
54) As night falls, the brothers bid adieu to the world, standing proud of their humble beginnings, their convergence on an epic journey to discover the unyielding strength of the human spirit that brooks no defeat.

- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Sebastian Schlencht-Wöhnert has a mundane life as a bank teller in Potsdam, Germany.
2) A zombie outbreak in Nevada dominates international news, giving him nightmares about zombies.
3) He also produces YouTube videos about safecracking that receive no attention until a mysterious figure comments on his most recent, inviting him to an underground safecracking competition.
4) Sebastian wins the contest and is introduced to Gwendoline Starr, a skilled jewel thief who had commented upon his YouTube video.
5) Gwendoline recruits Sebastian into a heist crew consisting of herself, expert hacker Korina Dominguez, getaway driver Rolph and gunman Brad Cage to break into three banks that have the three safes created by legendary locksmith Hans Wagner, which currently belongs to billionaire Bly Tanaka.
6) The safes will be decommissioned in less than a week, so time is running out for someone to break into them.
7) Sebastian, a theoretical expert on Wagner's work and safecracking but with no practical experience, is convinced by Gwendoline to join them for the challenge of breaking into a Wagner safe.
8) Together, the crew successfully undertake their heist of the first safe in Paris, escaping with only a fraction of the money that is actually in it.
9) Gwendoline justifies this as the challenge and reputation being better than any major monetary gain.
10) As the crew celebrates after the Paris heist, Sebastian develops feelings for Gwendoline, drawing jealousy from Brad, her boyfriend since their teenage years, learning his real name was Alexis.
11) The crew travels to Prague, the location of the second safe, and are followed by Delacroix, an obsessive Interpol agent leading a unit that has been trying to capture Gwendoline and the crew for years after Brad shot him during a theft.
12) Sebastian and Gwendoline enter the bank but are soon identified by security, forcing Brad to create a distraction with a pretend robbery.
13) Sebastian cracks the second safe, leaving with Gwendoline and another haul of money as Delacroix and his team race to the bank to stop them.
14) Brad is shot in the shoulder by a security guard and narrowly escapes the bank, ahead of Sebastian and Gwendoline.
15) Brad deliberately leaves Sebastian behind as the team flees, forcing him to shake off the pursuing police alone.
16) Angry at Brad's actions, Gwendoline and Korina leave the crew.
17) However, the original plan was to ditch Sebastian after the three heists were complete.
18) The women head back to Potsdam and reunite with Sebastian, telling him that the pursuit of the Wagner challenge is more important to them than any monetary gain.
19) The trio heads to St. Moritz, location of the last safe in Europe, while Interpol also arrives.
20) Delacroix's team believes they have a lead on the theft, only to be tricked again by them.
21) They hijacked the safe during its transfer from the casino.
22) Their hijacking also usurps Brad and Rolph's idea of robbing the safe.
23) Gwendoline and Sebastian leave St. Moritz on a lorry, chased by Brad and Rolph.
24) Korina, caught by Interpol, manages to warn them about the other two before selling them out in exchange for her family's safety.
25) Sebastian has to crack the safe in the lorry while Brad, Rolph, and Interpol pursue them.
26) He succeeds, finding another large haul of cash.
27) However, before they can leave with it, Rolph and an increasingly unstable Brad arrive.
28) Gwendoline overpowers and handcuffs them to the truck for Interpol to find before leaving with Sebastian.
29) Before escaping on a boat from the town of Hallstatt, Austria, Sebastian and Gwendoline confess their mutual feelings.
30) However, Delacroix catches them, resulting in a standoff between him and Gwendoline.
31) Out of love for Sebastian, she sacrifices herself to be arrested so that he can escape, promising to find him once she is free.
32) Sebastian goes, vowing he will be reunited with Gwendoline one day.
33) Later, Scott Ward and Maria Cruz find Sebastian's (now by Ludwig Dieter's name) locksmith shop in California.
34) They offer him the chance to crack Wagner's legendary "missing" safe, which Gwendoline and Sebastian had resolved to break together once she was free; Ludwig accepts the job.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Jack, a meticulous and hardworking architect from New York's ever-busy Manhattan, receives an electrifying job offer.
2) He is overjoyed when a leading German real estate developer presents him with his career's ultimate challenge, to design a 50-story, stage-of-the-art office skyscraper in Berlin, Germany.
3) He perceives this as the opportunity he's been dreaming of, the final chance to carve his name in the annals of skyscraper architecture.
4) Brimming with anticipation, he secures a lease for a stunning, artistically-decorated loft apartment in Friedrichshain, an East Berlin neighborhood renowned for its spirited graffities and unique urbanscape.
5) With hopes simmering in his heart, he sets foot aboard a Lufthansa flight from New York to Berlin.
6) Jet-lagged though excited, Jack lands in Berlin and drags his luggage, filled with designer clothes and precision drawing instruments, up to the fourth floor of his rental apartment.
7) But in the Altbau apartment, stamped with Berlin's distinctive architectural flavor, a complete stranger sprawls comfortably.
8) Eric, a local German rocker with unruly dreadlocks, has already made Jack's new home his own.
9) Caught off-guard, Jack whips out his freshly-printed lease papers, explaining that he leased the property just before leaving New York.
10) Eric, entirely unmoved and nonchalant, presents his own contract, revealing he had secured the apartment just a month prior.
11) Their heated debates about rightful ownership evolve into an exhausting three-hour dispute.
12) The documents clash, yet neither of the adamant men is ready to withdraw their claim.
13) Stricken with a lack of extra housing options and pushed by desperation, they concede to a tense agreement of rooming together temporarily until a solution is reached.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Quinn Ackerman, a quirky and intelligent high school senior, works as a technical director for the Thunderbirds, her high school's elite dance team, which is well known around the state as the reigning champions of the Work It dance competition.
2) When Quinn sets something on fire by accident, the ruthless leader of the Thunderbirds, Julliard Pembroke, fires her from the position.
3) Quinn's dream to attend Duke University, her late father's alma mater, is soured when the admissions counselor, Veronica Ramirez, informs that her chances of standing out to the admission's team are not good.
4) Quinn misleads Ramirez into thinking that she is a dancer on the Thunderbirds, even though she only worked the lighting.
5) Ramirez is instantly impressed, and vows to see her perform live at the Work It dance competition.
6) Though she considers confessing, Quinn instead decides to commit to it.
7) Quinn enlists the help of her best friend, Jasmine Hale, who is a dancer for the Thunderbirds herself, to teach her how to dance for the team's open auditions in two weeks.
8) Quinn's dancing skills improve substantially, but Julliard still rejects her.
9) After Jasmine stands up to him and defends Quinn, Julliard sarcastically suggests that the two start their own dance team, which Quinn does.
10) Jasmine reluctantly agrees to quit the Thunderbirds in favor of Quinn's new team.
11) Quinn and Jasmine research a former champion of the Work It competition, Jake Taylor, who stopped competing and vanished after a knee injury two years prior.
12) Quinn tracks him down and approaches him at the dance studio where he now works, and asks him to be a choreographer for her team, but Jake rejects her, insisting that dance is done with passion, not learned by thinking.
13) Meanwhile, the girls round up a group of unknown dancers at their school who all differ in style.
14) After seeing the team's potential during an informal dance meetup, Jake agrees to choreograph for Quinn's team, but only if they can win the upcoming qualifying competition by themselves.
15) Under the name "TBD", they cut qualifiers but on a technicality issue with an opposing team.
16) Jake and Quinn spend more time together, and one night, Jake takes her aside and decides to experiment with freestyle dancing with her.
17) As the two practice, Quinn's talent surfaces, and they kiss.
18) With newfound confidence, Quinn takes it easier on herself and puts more effort into her dancing and teamwork.
19) Quinn emails Veronica Ramirez and informs her that she has started her own team and that they will be competing at Work It.
20) However, when Julliard discovers that Jake is choreographing for the Quinn's team, he turns them in for using the studio to practice without paying, and Jake loses his job.
21) Quinn's grades drop due to her dedication to the team, and she receives an email from the Duke admissions team informing her that Veronica no longer works there.
22) Quinn confesses everything to her mom, and they agree that she should quit the dance team and bring her grades up before turning in her final transcript.
23) The team feels betrayed by Quinn's departure, especially Jasmine, who rejoins the Thunderbirds, and Quinn ends her romance with Jake.
24) She later rediscovers her own passion for dance and reconciles with Jake, and they both decide to bring the team back together.
25) Quinn reconciles with Jasmine, who quits the Thunderbirds and rejoins the TBDs.
26) The group begins to learn each other's unique dance styles, and Jake incorporates them into the choreography.
27) On the day of the competition, Quinn's mother discovers that she is still in dance and tries to stop her from leaving, but Quinn steals the car keys and leaves.
28) When Quinn arrives, the TBDs are already on stage, and she enters halfway through the act.
29) The TBDs narrowly win the competition over the Thunderbirds, and both Jasmine and Julliard are approached by a scout from the New York Dance Academy.
30) Quinn runs into Veronica, who is now working at NYU, and she invites her to apply for the fall semester.

- Point of No Return (tp3): 16.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.

Story, broken down into numbered sentences:

2) When Quinn sets something on fire by accident, the ruthless leader of the Thunderbirds, Julliard Pembroke, fires her from the position.
3) Quinn's dream to attend Duke University, her late father's alma mater, is soured when the admissions counselor, Veronica Ramirez, informs that her chances of standing out to the admission's team are not good.

5) Ramirez is instantly impressed, and vows to see her perform live at the Work It dance competition.
6) Though she considers confessing, Quinn instead decides to commit to it.
7) Quinn enlists the help of her best friend, Jasmine Hale, who is a dancer for the Thunderbirds herself, to teach her how to dance for the team's open auditions in two weeks.
8) Quinn's dancing skills improve substantially, but Julliard still rejects her.
9) After Jasmine stands up to him and defends Quinn, Julliard sarcastically suggests that the two start their own dance team, which Quinn does.
10) Jasmine reluctantly agrees to quit the Thunderbirds in favor of Quinn's new team.
11) Quinn and Jasmine research a former champion of the Work It competition, Jake Taylor, who stopped competing and vanished after a knee injury two years prior.
12) Quinn tracks him down and approaches him at the dance studio where he now works, and asks him to be a choreographer for her team, but Jake rejects her, insisting that dance is done with passion, not learned by thinking.
13) Meanwhile, the girls round up a group of unknown dancers at their school who all differ in style.

22) Quinn confesses everything to her mom, and they agree that she should quit the dance team and bring her grades up before turning in her final transcript.
23) The team feels betrayed by Quinn's departure, especially Jasmine, who rejoins the Thunderbirds, and Quinn ends her romance with Jake.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) As the film commences, the unmistakable ringing of an age-old alarm clock reverberates throughout an exquisitely pink suburban house.
2) This clamor marks the dawn of a fresh day in the life of the quintessential all-American Anderson family—John, his supportive wife Sarah, and their two bright-eyed, bushy-tailed school-going children, Emma and Tom.
3) Within the morning commotion of hurrying kids, breakfast chaos, and the rush against time, we are introduced to Max, the family's endlessly energetic Golden Retriever, who thrives in this disorder.
4) Max, with his tail wagging and tongue flopping, brings an element of mischief to their otherwise oh-so-normal household.
5) With Max around, everyday items like decorative pillows, cosy slippers, and TV remotes took on a new life, becoming toys for his playful antics.
6) His unchecked enthusiasm spills over into their dining area, causing a chaotic scene of overturned cereal bowls and displaced chairs, much to the family's amusement.
7) A heartening scene is drawn out when John, a seemingly unassuming character with the uneventful job of an accountant, is unintentionally caught under Max's morning greeting leap.
8) Despite the unexpected surprise, it is met with laughter and adds an unexpected excitement to their morning routine.
9) One fine morning, Max's penchant for chaos transcends the boundaries of the family home, leading them to a serene, mahogany-filled public library.
10) His boisterous excitement knocks down piles of exclusive historical literature off the shelves, sending hitherto untouched books flying all about the place.
11) Amidst this flurry of pages, Max's attention is caught by an ancient and worn-out book.
12) Upon examination, a tattered yet intriguing treasure map is revealed, hidden away in the confines of the centuries-old pages.
13) Stirred by the mysterious allure held by the possibilities the map unfolds, the family democratically votes in favour of venturing on a treasure hunt.
14) Their uneventful mundane life is brutally disrupted by this sudden bolt of adventure.
15) With a surprising knack to delineate the twisting lines on the map, Max leads the family on their amateurish treasure hunts.
16) His guidance takes them through twisted trails and maze-like lanes, fuelling their lives with a wild vivacity that was hitherto unknown.
17) The comic misadventures of the Anderson family catch the attention of two humorously incompetent villains, Larry and Barry.
18) They undeniably fixate on obtaining the ancient treasure map that has now become the centre of chaos in the peaceful suburban town.
19) A humorous subplot is prompted as Larry and Barry in their bungling awkwardness keep attempting and failing to steal the map.
20) They are consistently one step behind the adventurous Andersons, fuelling the comic relief in the film.
21) Meanwhile, Max’s courageous ventures unexpectedly catch the eye of diligent local reporters.
22) His sensationalised misinterpretations peg him as a "unique super dog," sending a wave of perplexity among the usually uneventful neighbourhood.
23) The Anderson family, earlier an unnoticed entity in their suburb, unpredictably find themselves amidst the explosive centre of town-wide attention, earning their gossip-worthy fame, thanks to their pet, Max.
24) The final act kicks off with a noticeable shift in the family's enthusiasm.
25) The once thrilling treasure hunt starts to drain the family, straining the harmony in their relationships.
26) The once secure accountancy job John held now hangs by a thread due to his unplanned leaves, Emma and Tom struggle to catch up with their academic commitments, and Sarah finds herself reduced to a short-tempered, tired woman.
27) Max's playful antics, previously a source of laughter and amusement, now become the cause of multiple stressful outbursts within the family.
28) Their tension rises, the chaos becomes overbearing, and the family yearns for their old peaceful life.
29) Just as the family nears their breaking point from the chaos ensuing from the treasure hunt, the bumbling villains Larry and Barry finally corner them in a dramatic confrontation.
30) In a humorous turn of events during their clumsy theft attempt, Max unknowingly tips over a nearby potted fern.
31) The domino effect this creates results in the villains stumbling over their own feet and hilariously landing in their own hastily placed trap.
32) The unfortunate fumble leads to Larry and Barry's immediate arrest by police alerted by the loud commotion.
33) The Anderson family expels a collective breath of relief, their faces beaming with pride, as their trusted pet once again saves the day.
34) With their morale boosted once again, the family takes it upon themselves to complete the adventure.
35) Motivated by Max's unique ability to interpret the map, they venture on the last leg of their treasure hunt with renewed enthusiasm.
36) Max, with his keen senses, tracks down the final location indicated on the worn-out map.
37) It points to a seemingly insignificant spot at the town park.
38) With everyone's bewildered eyes on him, Max starts digging and unearths a wooden box that holds the key to transforming their mundane existence forever.
39) As they pry open the box in eager anticipation, expecting a glorious sight of dazzling gold and gleaming gemstones, they discover something unexpected.
40) To their initial disappointment, they pull out a dust-covered, rusty old box filled with historical artifacts.
41) Soon, the family's disappointment transitions to awe as they understand the relevance of the items unearthed.
42) The artifacts are relics from the town's early settlers.
43) They realize that they have unintentionally discovered an indispensable fragment of their town's fascinating past.
44) The Andersons' unusual discovery earns them instant fame, not only within their community but also in the county’s historical circles.
45) Their hitherto mundane lives take an awe-inspiring turn, making them well-respected figures within their vicinity.
46) Upon returning home, it wasn't the mundanity of domestic life that awaited them, but a newfound fame that hailed them as the town's bravest adventurers.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 9.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.
- Change of Plans (tp2): 15.0 - Event where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action.
- Point of No Return (tp3): 22.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 28.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 41.0 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

Their condition can be approximated as a 7, indicating a rise in excitement and purpose.

### 4. Identify the third turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the second turning point.
The third turning point is at sentence 22: "Meanwhile, Max’s courageous ventures unexpectedly catch the eye of diligent local reporters."

Their condition can be approximated as an 8, indicating a further rise in their fortunes and recognition.

### 5. Identify the fourth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the third turning point.
The fourth turning point is at sentence 28: "Their tension rises, the chaos becomes overbearing, and the family yearns for their old peaceful life."
Relative to the third turning point, the family's situation has taken a turn for the worse. The chaos and stress of their adventures have started to negatively impact their relationships and well-being. Their condition can be approximated as a 2, indicating a significant downfall in their state of being, with increased stress and a desire to return to their simpler life.

### 6. Identify the fifth turning point and state the sentence corresponding to that turning point, and describe how it changed relative to the fourth turning point.
The fifth turning point is at sentence 41: "To their initial disappointment, they pull out a dust-covered, rusty old box filled with historical artifacts."
Relative to the fourth turning point, the family's discovery, although initially disappointing, leads to a realization of the significance of their find, which ultimately elevates their status and fulfills their adventure in a meaningful way. Their condition can be approximated as a 9, indicating a recovery and a rise to a higher state of being than before, with a sense of accomplishment and newfound respect.

### 7. Approximate the protagonist's condition in the story as a number from 0 to 10 at each turning point.
The list of the protagonist's conditions in chronological order is: 5, 7, 8, 2, 9.

### 8. Classify the story arc type based on the protagonist's condition list and explain your reasoning.
The story arc type can be classified as "Double Man in a Hole" because the protagonist's condition follows a pattern of improvement, followed by a significant decline, and then another improvement. Specifically, the family starts in a neutral state (5), improves as they embark on their adventure (7, 8), faces a significant setback as the chaos becomes overwhelming (2), and finally recovers and ends in a higher state after finding the historical artifacts and gaining fame (9). This pattern matches the "Double Man in a Hole" story arc, where the protagonist faces two cycles of dilemma and recovery.

### 9. Determine the story arc type.
Double Man in a Hole

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie commences with a panoramic view of the quaint landscapes of Provence — a serene symphony of pastures, vineyards, and blooming wildflowers, giving the audience a glimpse into the pastoral charms of rural France.
2) Nestled amidst the endless expanse of greenery, divided by a dense copse of mighty oaks, sit two seemingly disconnected estates — neighbours in proximity, yet distant otherwise, away from petites Pierres, their nearest settlement.
3) The focus, then, shifts to Jacques, a grizzled, weather-beaten old farmer stooped over his abundance of golden wheat field.
4) His eyes, though, hold a sorrow that belies his determined demeanor — a permanent void that had formed following the death of his dearly beloved wife, enshrouding him in a cloak of silent seclusion.
5) Separated by mere physical distance and yet worlds apart, Mathilde, the owner of the neighbouring estate is a stark contrast.
6) The enthusiastic lady whiles away her time in her art studio, finding comfort nestled amidst the riot of vibrant colours on her canvases.
7) However, the stability of Mathilde's artistic sanctuary is shattered when she observes the lavenders at the edge of her estate beginning to wilt and rot away, despite her heartfelt attempts to keep them flourishing.
8) Recognizing her limitations in dealing with the realms of cultivation, she grudgingly concedes, and approaches Jacques, her experienced neighbor, hoping for his expertise.
9) Jacques, albeit reluctant, decides to lend a helping hand.
10) He crosses over the stone boundary that separates their estates, examines Mathilde's struggling lavender plants, and provides her with practical farming advice.
11) Their initial meeting is characterized by hesitating smiles and awkward, misunderstood interactions, portraying the clashing worlds of two solitary yet similar individuals.
12) When a whisper about a mythical legend circulates through the humble settlement of petites Pierres — a story about enchanted thistle seeds bringing good fortune and prosperity, Jacques and Mathilde find their curiosity piqued.
13) Brought together by uncanny circumstances, they embark on a joint expedition to navigate the strangely mystical woods around them, navigating rivulets and wading through misty meadows in hopes of unearthing the legendary thistle seeds.
14) Through their journey, Jacques's in-depth knowledge of the land couples beautifully with Mathilde's innate understanding of colours and aesthetics — a balance that enlivens their otherwise tedious path while forging an unlikely friendship between them.
15) Their connection deepens as they tackle the riddles that lead to the thistle, using their individual abilities to solve the brainteasers that are part of the village lore.
16) Sparks flow under the night sky speckled with starlight.
17) Mathilde reveals her tumultuous past, a breathtaking canvas of Technicolor memories, while Jacques, too, shares his solitary dance with desolation.
18) Understanding each other's pasts, Jacques and Mathilde find their companionship transitioning into an unspoken bond, enabling them to steer through the tumultuous waves of loneliness.
19) The culmination of their joint adventure is marked by their perseverance, as they finally uncover the last mystical thistle seed hidden amidst thorny bushes.
20) On their return, they plant the seeds on Mathilde's bleak field, the symbolic convergence of their initially separate lives, marking a significant chapter in the history of petites Pierres.
21) As if by magic, the once barren field burgeons with lavender and thistles — a tangible representation of their flourishing companionship and emotional healing.
22) News of the miraculous revival of the once barren field spreads quickly through the many winding streets of petites Pierres, rekindling a sense of unity among the villagers.
23) The town's people, who were often overlooked in their secluded corners now come together in joy, celebrating and sharing Jacques and Mathilde's victory against the whims of destiny.
24) The tiny settlement, which was once a picture-postcard image of solitude, comes alive, echoing with laughter, chatter, and overall bonhomie — a result of the shared achievement.
25) The camera zooms out to encapsulate the thriving lavender fields in all their glory one last time, narrating an enduring tale of a friendship that blossomed against all odds.
26) Jacques and Mathilde are seen standing silently beside each other in the distance, their wrinkled faces reflecting the vibrant landscape — an emblem of newfound life.
27) The golden hues cast by the setting sun falling gently on their faces, they share a moment of quiet reflection before the eventual end, their eyes reflecting mutual respect and understanding.
28) The last shot freezes on their undisguised joy, bearing testament to their transformative journey against the backdrop of a rustic charm.
29) Their smiles, content and healed, signal the transformative magic that they discovered not just in their dying lavender but within their lives.
30) The ending depicts the rejuvenated lavender fields mirroring the newfound peace within Jacques and Mathilde, signifying a closure and the promise of a new beginning.
31) The closing scene captures their smiles, a token of their incredible journey towards healing, embedding upon its frame the essence of building genuine connections.
32) As the scene gradually fades into the black, Jacques and Mathilde's shared laughter carries within it the warmth of the golden setting sun.
33) An invigorated petites Pierres stands tall against the backdrop, a testament to the triumph of collaboration over a shared adversity.

- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

- Opportunity (tp1): 7.5 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.

### INSTRUCTIONS
Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) The movie commences with a panoramic view of the quaint landscapes of Provence — a serene symphony of pastures, vineyards, and blooming wildflowers, giving the audience a glimpse into the pastoral charms of rural France.
2) Nestled amidst the endless expanse of greenery, divided by a dense copse of mighty oaks, sit two seemingly disconnected estates — neighbours in proximity, yet distant otherwise, away from petites Pierres, their nearest settlement.
3) The focus, then, shifts to Jacques, a grizzled, weather-beaten old farmer stooped over his abundance of golden wheat field.
4) His eyes, though, hold a sorrow that belies his determined demeanor — a permanent void that had formed following the death of his dearly beloved wife, enshrouding him in a cloak of silent seclusion.
5) Separated by mere physical distance and yet worlds apart, Mathilde, the owner of the neighbouring estate is a stark contrast.
6) The enthusiastic lady whiles away her time in her art studio, finding comfort nestled amidst the riot of vibrant colours on her canvases.
7) However, the stability of Mathilde's artistic sanctuary is shattered when she observes the lavenders at the edge of her estate beginning to wilt and rot away, despite her heartfelt attempts to keep them flourishing.
8) Recognizing her limitations in dealing with the realms of cultivation, she grudgingly concedes, and approaches Jacques, her experienced neighbor, hoping for his expertise.
9) Jacques, albeit reluctant, decides to lend a helping hand.
10) He crosses over the stone boundary that separates their estates, examines Mathilde's struggling lavender plants, and provides her with practical farming advice.
11) Their initial meeting is characterized by hesitating smiles and awkward, misunderstood interactions, portraying the clashing worlds of two solitary yet similar individuals.
12) When a whisper about a mythical legend circulates through the humble settlement of petites Pierres — a story about enchanted thistle seeds bringing good fortune and prosperity, Jacques and Mathilde find their curiosity piqued.
13) Brought together by uncanny circumstances, they embark on a joint expedition to navigate the strangely mystical woods around them, navigating rivulets and wading through misty meadows in hopes of unearthing the legendary thistle seeds.
14) Through their journey, Jacques's in-depth knowledge of the land couples beautifully with Mathilde's innate understanding of colours and aesthetics — a balance that enlivens their otherwise tedious path while forging an unlikely friendship between them.
15) Their connection deepens as they tackle the riddles that lead to the thistle, using their individual abilities to solve the brainteasers that are part of the village lore.
16) Sparks flow under the night sky speckled with starlight.
17) Mathilde reveals her tumultuous past, a breathtaking canvas of Technicolor memories, while Jacques, too, shares his solitary dance with desolation.
18) Understanding each other's pasts, Jacques and Mathilde find their companionship transitioning into an unspoken bond, enabling them to steer through the tumultuous waves of loneliness.
19) The culmination of their joint adventure is marked by their perseverance, as they finally uncover the last mystical thistle seed hidden amidst thorny bushes.
20) On their return, they plant the seeds on Mathilde's bleak field, the symbolic convergence of their initially separate lives, marking a significant chapter in the history of petites Pierres.
21) As if by magic, the once barren field burgeons with lavender and thistles — a tangible representation of their flourishing companionship and emotional healing.
22) News of the miraculous revival of the once barren field spreads quickly through the many winding streets of petites Pierres, rekindling a sense of unity among the villagers.
23) The town's people, who were often overlooked in their secluded corners now come together in joy, celebrating and sharing Jacques and Mathilde's victory against the whims of destiny.
24) The tiny settlement, which was once a picture-postcard image of solitude, comes alive, echoing with laughter, chatter, and overall bonhomie — a result of the shared achievement.
25) The camera zooms out to encapsulate the thriving lavender fields in all their glory one last time, narrating an enduring tale of a friendship that blossomed against all odds.
26) Jacques and Mathilde are seen standing silently beside each other in the distance, their wrinkled faces reflecting the vibrant landscape — an emblem of newfound life.
27) The golden hues cast by the setting sun falling gently on their faces, they share a moment of quiet reflection before the eventual end, their eyes reflecting mutual respect and understanding.
28) The last shot freezes on their undisguised joy, bearing testament to their transformative journey against the backdrop of a rustic charm.
29) Their smiles, content and healed, signal the transformative magic that they discovered not just in their dying lavender but within their lives.
30) The ending depicts the rejuvenated lavender fields mirroring the newfound peace within Jacques and Mathilde, signifying a closure and the promise of a new beginning.
31) The closing scene captures their smiles, a token of their incredible journey towards healing, embedding upon its frame the essence of building genuine connections.
32) As the scene gradually fades into the black, Jacques and Mathilde's shared laughter carries within it the warmth of the golden setting sun.
33) An invigorated petites Pierres stands tall against the backdrop, a testament to the triumph of collaboration over a shared adversity.

input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) Marcus Johnson, an experienced plumber known across the quaint town of Los Manzanos, welcomes the day with an uplifting air.
2) The storyline transition to an aging Victorian-style house where, with expert precision and dexterity, Marcus remedies a stubborn clog in a double-bowl sink.
3) As the evening draws near, we see a glimpse of the Johnson family's close bond.
4) Sharing this table, Marcus, his wife Lily, a dedicated high school art teacher, and Lucas, their intelligent middle school-going son, vividly recount the day's events.
5) An air of anticipation sweeps across the town at the news of a major plumbing project.
6) The proposed state-of-the-art water treatment facility promises abundant economic prosperity that could propel the town towards a future of staggering growth.
7) Following the announcement, Marcus is chosen to spearhead this ground-breaking project, which offers a promise of a brighter future and stronger financial stability for his family.
8) However, a clandestine town hall meeting leaks veiled hints of covert plans and sly manipulations orbiting the project.
9) Disillusioned, Marcus pieces together the disturbing evidence, indicating the project might not be as beneficial as they've been led to believe.
10) The project aims to encroach upon the town park, an iconic landmark of Los Manzanos.
11) The proposed site alteration rings alarm bells for Marcus, who fears his town's peaceful life stands on the brink of unwelcome change.
12) Marcus musters the courage to unveil the truth, but his revelations fall on disbelieving ears.
13) The town, charmed by the eloquent project leaders, questions Marcus's motives instead.
14) The crisis also seeping into his household, his beloved wife, Lily, disputes Marcus's allegations against the project.
15) In their otherwise harmonious dwelling, tensions begin to brew.
16) Marcus, though deeply wounded by the lack of trust, has his resolve to protect Los Manzanos remain unshaken.
17) Armed with steely willpower, Marcus embarks on a daring mission to unearth concrete evidence that might convince the town of the lurking danger.
18) Braving immense challenges, Marcus dares to infiltrate the project's restricted construction site and eavesdrops on covert meetings, all in a bid to gather substantial evidence.
19) Utilizing his adept plumbing skills, Marcus ingeniously installs hidden recording devices, designed to capture damning conversations that could expose the deceit.
20) As the emotional toll of his isolation escalates, Marcus watches his once valued friendships gradually dissolve.
21) His relentless quest for truth eventually leads him to the discovery of indisputable evidence — Hidden contracts, covertly recorded conversations, and words that unmask the fraudulent scheme.
22) Armed with this concrete proof, Marcus boldly faces the town folks and local authorities at an emergent town hall meeting, drawing their attention to his well-documented discoveries.
23) A town once rigid with skepticism, with Marcus at the forefront, is now united in its quest for justice.
24) His innate leadership shines through as he galvanizes the townsfolk to band together, launching a civic lawsuit to overturn the potential harmful project.
25) Even while facing intimidating threats from the scathing project leaders on the court day, Marcus remains unyielding, a figure of resolute determination.
26) In court, his moving speech tremors through the room, rallying his once skeptical friends, and the rest of the community, together in collective struggle.
27) His innovative display of evidence coupled with his quick-witted responses unambiguously manages to persuade the court to halt the controversial project.
28) With the dawn of a new day, the camera captures the first break of serene daylight over the picturesque town of Los Manzanos.
29) As the golden rays of the morning sun paint the town, a contented smile spreads across Marcus's face as he overlooks the town from his picturesque porch, whispering a prayer of gratitude into the crisp air.
30) Marcus, just a regular plumber until recently, is revered as nothing less than a savior by the townsfolk.
31) His heroic act awards him a legendary status akin to a folk hero.
32) His act of courage proves to be an impeccable example of dedication, love, and unity for his son Lucas, and other young minds in town, sparking a new era of responsible citizens ready to stand up for their community.
33) In the final scene, Marcus stands on the edge of his beloved town, the sea of rooftops gleaming in the soft glow of dawn serving as testimony to his hard-won battle.
34) As the sun emerges, bathing his cherished town in golden hues, a content smile plays on Marcus's lips.

- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

- Point of No Return (tp3): 14.0 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 20.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 24.5 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.

12) Marcus musters the courage to unveil the truth, but his revelations fall on disbelieving ears.
13) The town, charmed by the eloquent project leaders, questions Marcus's motives instead.
14) The crisis also seeping into his household, his beloved wife, Lily, disputes Marcus's allegations against the project.
15) In their otherwise harmonious dwelling, tensions begin to brew.
16) Marcus, though deeply wounded by the lack of trust, has his resolve to protect Los Manzanos remain unshaken.
17) Armed with steely willpower, Marcus embarks on a daring mission to unearth concrete evidence that might convince the town of the lurking danger.
18) Braving immense challenges, Marcus dares to infiltrate the project's restricted construction site and eavesdrops on covert meetings, all in a bid to gather substantial evidence.
19) Utilizing his adept plumbing skills, Marcus ingeniously installs hidden recording devices, designed to capture damning conversations that could expose the deceit.
20) As the emotional toll of his isolation escalates, Marcus watches his once valued friendships gradually dissolve.
21) His relentless quest for truth eventually leads him to the discovery of indisputable evidence — Hidden contracts, covertly recorded conversations, and words that unmask the fraudulent scheme.
22) Armed with this concrete proof, Marcus boldly faces the town folks and local authorities at an emergent town hall meeting, drawing their attention to his well-documented discoveries.
23) A town once rigid with skepticism, with Marcus at the forefront, is now united in its quest for justice.
24) His innate leadership shines through as he galvanizes the townsfolk to band together, launching a civic lawsuit to overturn the potential harmful project.
25) Even while facing intimidating threats from the scathing project leaders on the court day, Marcus remains unyielding, a figure of resolute determination.
26) In court, his moving speech tremors through the room, rallying his once skeptical friends, and the rest of the community, together in collective struggle.
27) His innovative display of evidence coupled with his quick-witted responses unambiguously manages to persuade the court to halt the controversial project.
28) With the dawn of a new day, the camera captures the first break of serene daylight over the picturesque town of Los Manzanos.
29) As the golden rays of the morning sun paint the town, a contented smile spreads across Marcus's face as he overlooks the town from his picturesque porch, whispering a prayer of gratitude into the crisp air.
30) Marcus, just a regular plumber until recently, is revered as nothing less than a savior by the townsfolk.
31) His heroic act awards him a legendary status akin to a folk hero.
32) His act of courage proves to be an impeccable example of dedication, love, and unity for his son Lucas, and other young minds in town, sparking a new era of responsible citizens ready to stand up for their community.
33) In the final scene, Marcus stands on the edge of his beloved town, the sea of rooftops gleaming in the soft glow of dawn serving as testimony to his hard-won battle.
34) As the sun emerges, bathing his cherished town in golden hues, a content smile plays on Marcus's lips.

Story Arc Types:
- Rags to Riches: Protagonist starts disadvantaged and ends better (e.g., 0→1→2→4→10)
- Riches to Rags: Protagonist starts high and ends lower (e.g., 10→9→8→6→0)
- Man in a Hole: Protagonist falls into trouble but recovers (e.g., 6→2→1→4→10)
- Icarus: Protagonist rises then falls dramatically (e.g., 2→4→9→5→1)
- Double Man in a Hole: Two cycles of fall and recovery (e.g., 6→2→7→4→10)
- Cinderella: Rise, setback, ultimate triumph (e.g., 1→7→4→1→10)
- Oedipus: Start high, fall, recover, final fall (e.g., 10→4→7→9→1)

Ground Truth Turning Points:
- Opportunity (tp1): 6.0 - Introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters.

- Major Setback (tp4): 20.5 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.
- Climax (tp5): 24.5 - Final event/resolution of the main story (the "biggest spoiler").

    At the end of your reasoning, simply state the determined story arc.
    ### RESPONSE

Analyze the story and classify it into one of the story arc types based on the protagonist's condition at each turning point. Explain your reasoning step by step.
input:
### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) An old man conducts a ritual by slaughtering a chicken and hurriedly spreading ash in a circle.
2) His sickly wife appears at the door and tells him to stop, to which he replies "Burn in hell".
3) He starts reading from a book and the letters start to bleed.
4) Then a little girl whispers his name, Yosille, and asks him if he wants to see his wife again, to which he replies negatively.
5) He steps outside the circle, swallowing a dark smoke as his sclera turns black.
6) He then stabs himself with a knife from his back pocket.
7) The demon tries to remove the amulet around his neck to no avail.
8) Arthur (Art) and his pregnant wife come to Brooklyn to visit his father, who runs a Jewish funeral house in a Hasidic community.
9) He and his father, Saul, became estranged after he married Claire, a non-Jewish British food journalist.
10) Saul is welcoming to Art and Claire, wanting to establish a relationship with both of them.
11) Art has an alternative agenda for the visit.
12) He needs his father to mortgage his house to help his failing real estate business.
13) Art volunteers to help his father with a new suicide body that has come in.
14) The funeral home is the basement of their home.
15) Art has a run in with Heimish, who works with his father.
16) Heimish cares for Saul and is suspicious of Art's visit.
17) As Saul and Heimish speak, Arthur prepares the body of Yosille.
18) While preparing the body, the amulet around his neck falls through a drain, releasing the demon which immediately begins to haunt Claire.
19) Saul comes across the knife that Yosille used to commit suicide and becomes suspicious.
20) He calls Reb Chayim and asks about the inscription.
21) Reb Chayim tells Saul that this, in conjunction with an amulet is used for a binding spell.
22) But as there was no amulet found, Chayim dismisses its importance.
23) Meanwhile, Art and Heimish go to pick up another body.
24) It is the body of Sarah Scheindel, a missing girl from the community.
25) Heimish picks up Art's phone and discovers Art's money problems and his intention to ask his father to mortgage his house.
26) Heimish exposes Art in front of Saul and Claire.
27) When Claire confronts Art, he opens up to her about his loss of faith after the death of his mother.
28) That night, while Saul is in the mortuary, the demon attacks and kills him.
29) Art wakes up the next day to see men praying around his father's body.
30) Heimish blames Art saying he died of a broken heart and gives him the paper that Art needed Saul to sign.
31) During the funeral both Art and Claire have disturbing visions.
32) Claire has visions of Sarah Schneidel.
33) Art sleepwalks and draws a sigil.
34) He wakes up on a carpet and thinks he was dreaming.
35) Art struggles to wrap up his father's business as Heimish has quit.
36) He is told that Yosille needs a police clearance before he can be buried or a next-of-kin must sign off on it, even though it was a clear suicide.
37) He goes to Yosille's house where he finds a video tape.
38) He discovers Yosille was attempting to conjure the archangel of life, Martiel, so that he could bring back his dead wife Aida.
39) He used Sarah for the ritual.
40) But the ritual killed Sarah and conjured the demon Abyzou instead.
41) Meanwhile, “Aida” comes to visit Claire and tells her she wants to see her husband's body.
42) When Claire tells her husband Aida is here to see Yosille's body, Art realizes his wife is in danger.
43) While Claire is on the phone, “Aida” burns Yosille's body, which releases the Abyzou.
44) Art tries to rescue his wife, but is unable to.
45) Art turns to Heimish and shows him Yosille's video.
46) Heimish brings in Chayim for help.
47) They discover the sigil and Chayim says that the demon gains strength and is fed when a child steps in it.
48) Chayim explains the binding ritual and explains that Abyzou has to be trapped in a body.
49) Art is willing to sacrifice himself for his wife and child.
50) Abyzou kills Chayim, so Art and Heimish rush to begin the ritual.
51) Heimish tells Art not to step outside the circle, but Heimish is taken by the demon.
52) Art begins the ritual, but he sees his wife who is taken and threatened by the demon.
53) He leaves the circle to rescue his wife who is being held against a high window.
54) Unable to do anything else, Art finishes the inscription to force the demon inside him, but he is unable to kill himself.
55) Heimish crawls to him and Art begs Heimish to stab him with the inscripted knife.
56) Heimish reluctantly stabs Art, then tells him that he should have stayed in the circle.
57) Heimish alludes to the amulet that has been taken off and flung across the room.
58) Art then sees the real Heimish's dead body in the next room, and dies helplessly.
59) Claire wakes up under a table.
60) She rushes to the demon masquerading as Art, but looks down to see she is standing in the sigil.
61) Abyzou appears and takes her.

- Point of No Return (tp3): 36.5 - Event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal.
- Major Setback (tp4): 29.0 - Event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently.

He begins in a neutral state (5), faces challenges and complications (5 to 4), experiences a major setback with his father's death (2), and ultimately ends in a desperate and tragic situation (1). This progression from a relatively stable or neutral position to a much worse state aligns with the **Riches to Rags** story arc, where the protagonist's condition deteriorates over the course of the story.

### 9. State the determined story arc type.
Riches to Rags

### INPUT 
Story, broken down into numbered sentences:
1) In Salem, Massachusetts, Hubie Dubois, a kind but dimwitted and cowardly delicatessen employee, is bullied by most of the city, and the victim of many practical jokes.
2) He has annoyed police sergeants Steve Downey, Blake and Father Dave for ages.
3) Hubie spends his Halloweens monitoring the city as the official Halloween Helper.
4) The day before Halloween, Hubie meets his strange new neighbor Walter Lambert, and news spreads around town about Richie Hartman, a convict and childhood friend of Hubie who has absconded from a local mental institution.
5) On Halloween day Hubie, working as Halloween Monitor, investigates Walter's home after hearing strange noises.
6) Reporting this to the police, he is "recruited" by Downey as an "AUU" (auxiliary undercover unit).
7) Hubie believes this assignment is genuine, but it is really just something Steve tells Hubie in hopes it will refrain Hubie from bothering him.
8) Hubie goes to a local Halloween party to monitor the activities, however, it soon turns sour.
9) He is tricked into going into a corn maze seeking a lost child.
10) Hubie's young co-worker Mike follows hoping to scare Hubie.
11) He finds Mike and watches him get pulled into the maze and then disappearing.
12) Hubie moves his attention to a drive-in cinema, where his old classmates Lester and Mary Hennessey scare him.
13) They falsely report suspicious activity in one of the cars (who turn out to be trick-or-treaters driven by Mr. Hennessey to throw eggs at Hubie).
14) Hubie flees into the woods and finds Walter, who thinks he is turning into a werewolf.
15) He chases Hubie to a haunted house in a fun fair that is overseen by Chantal Taylor.
16) Mr. and Mrs. Hennessey are kidnapped and Sgt.
17) Downey is alerted.
18) At the haunted house, Hubie sees a male Siberian Husky, believing he is Walter in his final form.
19) The dog defecates and eats his own feces while Hubie attempts to interrogate and confront him, runs into the haunted house and he chases him inside.
20) It is eventually shown that the Husky is Miss Taylor's dog named Buster.
21) Pete Landolfa goes in to scare Hubie, but is kidnapped right in front of him.
22) Sgt.
23) Downey arrives and suggests to Mayor Benson that they cancel Halloween.
24) Hubie thinks it is Walter, but then Blake calls Downey.
25) Walter has been at the police station with Richie, as they had turned themselves in.
26) Walter's real name is Nick Hudson and Richie had escaped to bring him back to the mental institution, which they refer to as the werewolf treatment center.
27) Downey, Benson, and Dave believe that Hubie is the kidnapper and is getting revenge on his bullies.
28) He runs away and goes to the radio station.
29) DJ Aurora tells Hubie that someone calls a lot more than him always requesting a song for Hubie.
30) They all think Sgt.
31) Downey's ex-wife Violet Valentine is the caller.
32) The burner phone that was planted when called is revealed to be in Hubie's house and he races there, hoping his mother is okay.
33) It is revealed that Hubie's mother kidnapped Pete, Mike, and the Hennesseys as revenge for tormenting Hubie and plans to burn them alive.
34) He rescues them just as the police, the news media, Nick, and Richie arrive, but they are still ungrateful.
35) His mother then scolds them all for the things they did to Hubie and they admit that they were jealous of him for various reasons.
36) Hubie's mother suddenly disappears upon using the Frankenstein trick.
37) One year later, Hubie is married to Violet, is the new Mayor of Salem, and his new foster kids are going trick or treating dressed like people they know.
38) Having earned respect from the locals, Hubie goes into town on his bicycle with Downey escorting him and prepares for the Halloween festivities.
